quote: Dare to begin! He who postpones living rightly is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
author: Horace

quote: Nothing ventured  nothing gained.
author: Anonymous

quote: The brave venture anything.
author: Anonymous

quote: The difference between getting somewhere and nowhere is the courage to make an early start.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: We ought to face our destiny with courage.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: You can surmount the obstacles in your path if you are determined  courageous and hardworking. ... Do not fear to pioneer  to venture down new paths of endeavor.
author: Ralph J. Bunche

quote: The great man is the man who does a thing for the first time.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: Imposing limitations on yourself is cowardly because it protects you from having to try  and perhaps failing.
author: Vladimir Zworykin

quote: What you can do  or dream you can do  begin it  boldness has genius  power and magic in it.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: We need the courage to start and continue what we should do  and courage to stop what we shouldn't do.
author: Richard L. Evans

quote: Prudence which degenerates into timidity is very seldom the path to safety.
author: Viscount Cecil

quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: We can easily become as much slaves to precaution as we can to fear.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Do not be too timid and squeamish. ... All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make  the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage is rarely reckless or foolish ... courage usually involves a highly realistic estimate of the odds that must be faced.
author: Margaret Truman

quote: Valour lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: When you're my size in the pros  fear is a sign that you're not stupid.
author: Jerry Levias

quote: Keep your fears to yourself  but share your courage with others.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Courage leads starward  fear toward death.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Fate loves the fearless.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: There is no such thing as bravery  only degrees of fear.
author: John Wainwright

quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: Courage is fear that has said its prayers.
author: Dorothy Bernard

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Courage is the ability to solve problems realistically in the presence of fear.
author: Stuart Walker

quote: Courage is resistance to fear  mastery of fear-not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Courage is ... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is the right disposition toward fear.
author: Anonymous

quote: Courage is a scorner of things which inspire fear.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: We must constantly build dykes of courage to hold back the flood of fear.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Courage is never letting your actions be influenced by your fears.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: Cowards cannot see that their greatest safety lies in dauntless courage.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: A coward turns away  but a brave man's choice is danger.
author: Euripides

quote: Cowardice is the mother of cruelty.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Optimism and self-pity are the positive and negative poles of modern cowardice.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths  the valiant never taste of death but once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: To say a person is a coward has no more meaning than to say he is lazy: It simply tells us that some vital potentiality is unrealized or blocked.
author: Rollo May

quote: There are at least two kinds of cowards. One kind always lives with himself  afraid to face the world. The other kind lives with the world  afraid to face himself.
author: Roscoe Snowden

quote: There is a time when to avoid trouble is to store up trouble  and when to seek for a lazy and a cowardly peace is to court a still greater danger.
author: William Barclay

quote: To know what is right and not do it is the worst cowardice.
author: Confucius

quote: Spiritual cowardice is not only weakness but wickedness.
author: J. B. Gambrell

quote: The most mortifying infirmity in human nature ... is  perhaps  cowardice.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Men perish by the sword  cowards by disease.
author: Phillippus

quote: Between cowardice and despair  valour is gendered.
author: John Donne

quote: If you knew how cowardly your enemy is  you would slap him.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Bravery is the knowledge of the cowardice in the enemy.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning.
author: George Eliot

quote: The coward despairs.
author: Euripides

quote: Cowardice  as distinguished from panic  is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend the functioning of the imagination.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The only cowards are sinners  fighting the fight is all.
author: John G. Neihardt

quote: All men would be cowards if they durst.
author: John Wilmot, Earl of Rochester

quote: That cowardice is incorrigible which the love of power cannot overcome.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Courage is doing what you're afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you're scared.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Courage is being scared to death ... and saddling up anyway.
author: John Wayne

quote: You look at a guy who's being brave. He's afraid  or he wouldn't be brave. If he isn't afraid  he's stupid.
author: Joe Torre

quote: To fight a bull when you are not scared is nothing. And to not fight a bull when you are scared is nothing. But to fight a bull when you are scared is something.
author: Anonymous

quote: Being "brave" means doing or facing something frightening. ... Being "fearless" means being without fear.
author: Penelope Leach

quote: It takes courage to know when you ought to be afraid.
author: James A. Michener

quote: Everyone thought I was bold and fearless and even arrogant  but inside I was always quaking.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Perfect courage means doing unwitnessed what we would be capable of with the world looking on.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Fear is the single strongest motivating force in our lives. ... The more frightened you become  the better your chances of achieving success.
author: Lois Korey

quote: Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death. -General Omar N. Bradley This morning I threw up at a board meeting. I was sure the cat was out of the bag  but no one seemed to think anything about it  apparently it's quite common for people to throw up at board meetings.
author: Jane Wagner

quote: I'm a real pussycat-with an iron tail.
author: Rona Barrett

quote: Bravery is being the only one who knows you're afraid.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: Necessity makes even the timid brave.
author: Sallust

quote: Necessity does the work of courage.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: I became more courageous by doing the very things I needed to be courageous for-first  a little  and badly. Then  bit by bit  more and better. Being avidly-sometimes annoy-ingly-curious and persistent about discovering how others were doing what I wanted to do.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: When it comes to the pinch  human beings are heroic.
author: George Orwell

quote: Many become brave when brought to bag.
author: Norwegian proverb

quote: Courage mounteth with occasion.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: When you have no choice  mobilize the spirit of courage.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Courage is sustained by calling up anew the vision of the goal.
author: A. G. Sertillanges

quote: Women have to summon up courage to fulfill dormant dreams.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Courage is like love  it must have hope for nourishment.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Optimism is the foundation of courage.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: I would often be a coward  but for the shame of it.
author: Ralph Connor

quote: At the bottom of a good deal of bravery ... lurks a miserable cowardice. Men will face powder and steel because they cannot face public opinion.
author: Edwin H. Chapin

quote: We would be cowards  if we had courage enough.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A coward's fear can make a coward valiant.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Courage is as often the outcome of despair as of hope  in the one case we have nothing to lose  in the other everything to gain.
author: Diane de Poitiers

quote: Despair gives courage to a coward.
author: Anonymous

quote: No one has yet computed how many imaginary triumphs are silently celebrated by people each year to keep up their courage.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: I'm not afraid of too many things  and I got that invincible kind of attitude from my father.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Courage is the fear of being thought a coward.
author: Horace Smith

quote: How  then  find the courage for action? By slipping a little into unconsciousness  spontaneity  instinct which holds one to the earth and dictates the relatively good and useful. ... By accepting the human condition more simply  and candidly  by dreading troubles less  calculating less  hoping more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: It takes courage to live-courage and strength and hope and humor. And courage and strength and hope and humor have to be bought and paid for with pain and work and prayers and tears.
author: Jerome P. Fleishman

quote: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man ... courage which arises from a sense of duty acts in a uniform manner.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: He who knows how to suffer everything can dare everything.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Courage does not always march to airs blown by a bugle  it is not always wrought out of the fabric ostentation wears.
author: Frances Rodman

quote: We learn courageous action by going forward whenever fear urges us back.
author: David Seabury

quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life in order to keep it.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Courage isrequired not only in a person's occasional crucial decision for his own freedom  but in the little hour-to-hour decisions which place the bricks in the structure of his building of himself into a person who acts with freedom and responsibility.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage does not consist in calculation  but in fighting against chances.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Courage is its own reward.
author: Plautus

quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Courage is the lovely virtue-the rib of Himself that God sent down to His children.
author: Sir James M. Barrie

quote: Courage is the integrating strength that causes one to overcome tragedy.
author: Eugene E. Brussell

quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Courage is the virtue which champions the cause of right.
author: Cicero

quote: Courage is generosity of the highest order  for the brave are prodigal of the most precious things.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Courage is clearly a readiness to risk self-humiliation.
author: Nigel Dennis

quote: Courage is fire  and bullying is smoke.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Courage consists of the power of self-recovery.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage is a virtue only so far as it is directed by prudence.
author: Francois de Fenelon

quote: Courage is a quality so necessary for maintaining virtue that it is always respected even when it is associated with vice.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Courage is the footstool of the Virtues  upon which they stand.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Courage is to feel the daily daggers of relentless steel and keep on living.
author: Douglas Malloch

quote: Courage is what preserves our liberty  safety  life  and our homes and parents  our country and children. Courage comprises all things.
author: Plautus

quote: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
author: Charles Kennedy

quote: There is plenty of courage among us for the abstract  but not for the concrete.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Every man has his own courage  and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If we have the courage and tenacity of our forebears  who stood firmly like a rock against the lash of slavery  we shall find a way to do for our day what they did for theirs.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: If you are brave too often  people will come to expect it of you.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: The best protection any woman can have ... is courage.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Valor is a gift. Those having it never know for sure if they have it till the test comes. And those having it in one test never know for sure if they will have it when the next test comes.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Until the day of his death  no man can be sure of his courage.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Among wellborn spirits courage does not depend on age.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: Courage can't see around corners  but goes around them anyway.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Freedom is not for the timid.
author: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit

quote: Courage easily finds its own eloquence.
author: Plautus

quote: In true courage there is always an element of choice  of an ethical choice  and of anguish  and also of action and deed. There is always a flame of spirit in it  a vision of some necessity higher than oneself.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: But screw your courage to the sticking place and we'll not fail.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Courage is always the surest wisdom.
author: Wilfred Grenfell

quote: Courage is very important. Like a muscle  it is strengthened by use.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: There are some women who seem to be born without fear  just as there are people who are born without the ability to feel pain. ... Providence appears to protect such women  maybe out of astonishment.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: On many of the great issues of our time  men have lacked wisdom because they have lacked courage.
author: William Benton

quote: Catch courage.
author: Carolyn Heilbrun

quote: If you are scared to go to the brink  you are lost.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: It takes courage to lead a life. Any life.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Nothing is as valuable to a man as courage.
author: Terence

quote: I'd rather give my life than be afraid to give it.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Courage ought to have eyes as well as arms.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Sorrow is a fruit. God does not allow it to grow on a branch that is too weak to bear it.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The will of God will not take you where the grace of God cannot keep you.
author: Anonymous

quote: Act  and God will act.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: So when the crisis is upon you  remember that God  like a trainer of wrestlers  has matched you with a tough and stalwart antagonist... that you may prove a victor at the Great Games.
author: Epictetus

quote: Act boldly and unseen forces will come to your aid.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: What God expects us to attempt  He also enables us to achieve.
author: Stephen Olford

quote: God gave burdens  also shoulders.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: With them I gladly shared my all and learned the great truth that where God guides  He provides.
author: Frank N. D. Buchman

quote: The Bible tells us that a sparrow does not fall without God's notice. I know he will help us meet our responsibilities through his guidance.
author: Michael Cardone

quote: Leap  and the net will appear.
author: Julie Cameron

quote: Cowards falter  but danger is often overcome by those who nobly dare.
author: Queen Elizabeth I

quote: God gives us always strength enough  and sense enough  for everything He wants us to do.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Fatalism is a lazy man's way of accepting the inevitable.
author: Natalie Clifford Barney

quote: In this unbelievable universe in which we live  there are no absolutes. Even parallel lines  reaching into infinity  meet somewhere yonder.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Instead of looking at life as a narrowing funnel  we can see it ever widening to choose the things we want to do  to take the wisdom we've learned and create something.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: Nothing befalls a man except what is in his nature to endure.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Life only demands from you the strength you possess.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Everyone will be taxed according to his means.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: I discovered I always have choices and sometimes it's only a choice of attitude.
author: Judith M. Knowlton

quote: The burden is equal to the horse's strength.
author: Talmud

quote: Experience shows that exceptions are as true as rules.
author: Edith Ronald Mirrielees

quote: What we call reality is an agreement that people have arrived at to make their lives more livable.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: All we are asked to bear we can bear. That is a law of the spiritual life. The only hindrance to the working of this law  as of all benign laws  is fear.
author: Elizabeth Goudge

quote: When it comes to the pinch  human beings are heroic.
author: George Orwell

quote: The incurable ills are the imaginary ills
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: However confused the scene of our life appears  however torn we may be who now do face that scene  it can be faced  and we can go on to be whole.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: A change of heart is the essence of all other change  and it has brought about me a reeducation of the mind.
author: Emmeline Pethick-Lawrence

quote: The human spirit is stronger than anything that can happen to it.
author: George. C. Scott

quote: What one has to do usually can be done.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Man performs and engenders so much more than he can or should have to bear. That's how he finds that he can bear anything.
author: William Faulkner

quote: If you have enough fantasies  you're ready  in the event that something happens.
author: Sheila Ballantyne

quote: The peril of the hour moved the British to tremendous exertions  just as always in a moment of extreme danger things can be done which had previously been thought impossible. Mortal danger is an effective antidote for fixed ideas.
author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

quote: We all carry it within us: supreme strength  the fullness of wisdom  unquenchable joy. It is never thwarted  and cannot be destroyed.
author: Huston Smith

quote: Within us all there are wells of thought and dynamos of energy which are not suspected until emergencies arise. Then oftentimes we find that it is comparatively simple to double or triple our former capacities and to amaze ourselves by the results achieved.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: The spirit of man is an inward flame  a lamp the world blows upon but never puts out.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: We have what we seek. It is there all the time  and if we give it time  it will make itself known to us.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Truth is not introduced into the individual from without  but was within him all the time.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Nature arms each man with some faculty which enables him to do easily some feat impossible to any other.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: When we know what we want to prove  we go out and find our facts. They are always there.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Nature reacts not only to physical disease  but also to moral weakness  when the danger increases  she gives us greater courage.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: rouble creates a capacity to handle it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Trouble  like the hill ahead  straightens out when you advance upon it.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: In the darkest hour the soul is replenished and given strength to continue and endure.
author: Heart Warrior Chosa

quote: Our energy is in proportion to the resistance it meets. We attempt nothing great but from a sense of the difficulties we have to encounter  we persevere in nothing great but from a pride in overcoming them.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: We shall draw from the heart of suffering itself the means of inspiration and survival.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Exigencies create the necessary ability to meet and conquer them.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: The moment one definitely commits oneself  then Providence moves too. All sorts of things occur to help that would never otherwise have occurred. A stream of events issues from the decision  raising unforeseen incidents and meetings and material assistance  which no man could have dreamt would have come his way.
author: W. H. Murray

quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions. But I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them  and make them right.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Often the test of courage is not to die but to live.
author: Vittorio Conte Alfieri

quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
author: Cicero

quote: When moral courage feels that it is in the right  there is no personal daring of which it is incapable.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: Fortune and Love befriend the bold.
author: Ovid

quote: Women and men of retiring timidity are cowardly only in dangers which affect themselves  but the first to rescue when others are endangered.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Hail  Caesar  those who are about to die salute thee.
author: Suetonius

quote: The small courtesies sweeten life  the greater ennoble it.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: A moral  sensible  and well-bred man Will not affront me  and no other can.
author: William Cowper

quote: He who fights and runs away May live to fight another day. But he who is in battle slain  Can never rise to fight again.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: A cowardly act! What do I care about that? You may be sure that I should never fear to commit one if it were to my advantage.
author: Napoleon

quote: A cowardly cur barks more fiercely than it bites.
author: Quintus Curtius Rufus

quote: All men would be cowards if they durst.
author: Earl of Rochester

quote: One who in a perilous emergency thinks with his legs.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Personal liberty is the paramount essential to human dignity and human happiness.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Hereditary boundsmen! Know ye not Who would be free themselves must strike the blow?
author: Lord Byron

quote: And Freedom shrieked as Kosciusko fell!
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: In a free country there is much clamor  with little suffering  in a despotic state there is little complaint  with much grievance.
author: Lazare Carnot

quote: For what avail the plough or sail  Or land  or life  if freedom fail?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Ay  call it holy ground  The soil where first they trod  They have left unstained  what there they found  -  Freedom to worship God.
author: Felicia D. Hemans

quote: In the beauty of the lilies Christ was born across the sea  With a glory in His bosom that transfigures you and me  As He died to make men holy  let us die to make men free  While God is marching on.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: I am for freedom of religion and against all maneuvers to bring about a legal ascendancy of one sect over another.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: And ye shall know the truth  and the truth shall make you free.
author: Bible

quote: Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves and under a just God cannot long retain it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: ... That this nation  under God  shall have a new birth of freedom.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Since the general civilization of mankind I believe there are more instances of the abridgement of the freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments of those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations.
author: James Madison

quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good in our own way  so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs or impede their efforts to obtain it.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: We must be free or die  who speak the tongue That Shakespeare spake  the faith and morals hold Which Milton held.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: No amount of political freedom will satisfy the hungry masses.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: I would rather sit on a pumpkin  and have it all to myself  than to be crowded on a velvet cushion.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I never saw a Purple Cow  I never hope to see one: But I can tell you  anyhow I'd rather see than be one.
author: Gelett Burgess

quote: There was an old man who said  "How Shall I flee from this horrible cow? I will sit on this stile  and continue to smile  Which may soften the heart of that cow."
author: Edward Lear

quote: The reality is that changes are coming. ... They must come. You must share in bringing them.
author: John Hersey

quote: After you've done a thing the same way for two years  look it over carefully. After five years  look at it with suspicion. And after ten years  throw it away and start all over.
author: Alfred Edward Perlman

quote: All that philosophers have done is interpret the world in different ways. It is our job to change it.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Christians are supposed not merely to endure change  nor even to profit by it  but to cause it.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: If you have no will to change it  you have no right to criticize it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Changes are not predictable  but to deny them is to be an accomplice to one's own unnecessary vegetation.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: We must learn to view change as a natural phenomenon-to anticipate it and to plan for it. The future is ours to channel in the direction we want to go ... we must continually ask ourselves  "What will happen if ... ?" or better still  "How can we make it happen?"
author: Lisa Taylor

quote: One must change one's tactics every ten years if one wishes to maintain one's superiority.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: New things cannot come where there is no room.
author: Mario Morgan

quote: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
author: Charles Du Bos

quote: When patterns are broken  new worlds emerge.
author: Tuli Kupferberg

quote: One must lose one's life in order to find it.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: This Mouse must give up one of his Mouse ways of seeing things in order that he may grow.
author: Hyemeyohsts Storm

quote: Compromise  if not the spice of life  is its solidity.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: The only alternative to war is peace and the only road to peace is negotiations.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Every one should keep a mental wastepaper basket and the older he grows the more things he will consign to it-torn up to irrecoverable tatters.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Unless one says goodbye to what one loves  and unless one travels to completely new territories  one can expect merely a long wearing away of oneself and an eventual extinction.
author: Jean Dubuffet

quote: "How does one become a butterfly?" she asked pensively. "You must want to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar."
author: Trina Paulus

quote: No matter how far you have gone on a wrong road  turn back.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Duration is not a test of true or false.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: It is only an error in judgement to make a mistake  but it shows infirmity of character to adhere to it when discovered.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: If you board the wrong train  it is no use running along the corridor in the other direction.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: It's never too late-in fiction or in life-to revise.
author: Nancy Thayer

quote: Any path is only a path  and there is no affront  to oneself or to others  in dropping it if that is what your heart tells you.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: There is a time for departure even when there's no certain place to go.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Being stuck is a position few of us like. We want something new but cannot let go of the old-old ideas  beliefs  habits  even thoughts. We are out of contact with our own genius. Sometimes we know we are stuck  sometimes we don't. In both cases we have to do something.
author: Inga Teekens

quote: My success was not based so much on any great intelligence but on great common sense.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: Lose yourself wholly  and the more you lose  the more you will find.
author: Saint Catherine of Siena

quote: Heroes take journeys  confront dragons  and discover the treasure of their true selves.
author: Carol Pearson

quote: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you  they're supposed to help you discover who you are.
author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

quote: Just as we outgrow a pair of trousers  we outgrow acquaintances  libraries  principles  etc.  at times before they're worn out and times-and this is the worst of all-before we have new ones.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: It is best to learn as we go  not go as we have learned.
author: Leslie Jeanne Sahler

quote: Those interested in perpetuating present conditions are always in tears about the marvelous past that is about to disappear  without having so much as a smile for the young future.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: I will not change just to court popularity.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Innovation! One cannot be forever innovating. I want to create classics.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Have no fear of change as such and  on the other hand  no liking for it merely for its own sake.
author: Robert Moses

quote: If you want to stand out  don't be different  be outstanding.
author: Meredith West

quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything ... or nothing.
author: Lady Astor

quote: To change and to improve are two different things.
author: German proverb

quote: Our fathers valued change for the sake of its results  we value it in the act.
author: Alice Meynell

quote: We must beware of needless innovations  especially when guided by logic.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: All change is not growth  as all movement is not forward.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.
author: Irene Peter

quote: None are happy but by the anticipation of change. The change itself is nothing  when we have made it  the next wish is to change again.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: We accept the verdict of the past until the need for change cries out loudly enough to force upon us a choice between the comforts of further inertia and the irksomeness of action.
author: Learned Hand

quote: To some will come a time when change itself is beauty  if not heaven.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quote: Today is not yesterday  how can our works and thoughts  if they are always to be the fittest  continue always the same? Change  indeed  is painful  yet ever needful.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Security can only be achieved through constant change  through discarding old ideas that have outlived their usefulness and adapting others to current facts.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: You had better be ready to change your mind when needed.
author: Henry B. Wilson

quote: Loyalty to petrified opinion never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul.
author: Mark Twain

quote: They were so strong in their beliefs that there came a time when it hardly mattered what exactly those beliefs were  they all fused into a single stubbornness.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: We are chameleons  and our partialities and prejudices change place with an easy and blessed facility.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Our firmest convictions are apt to be the most suspect  they mark our limitations and our bounds. Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: It often takes more courage to change one's opinion than to stick to it.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: All our final resolutions are made in a state of mind which is not going to last.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: It's an ill plan that cannot be changed.
author: Latin proverb

quote: The death of dogma is the birth of reality.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: If anyone accuses me of contradicting myself  I reply: Because I have been wrong once  or oftener  I do not aspire to be always wrong.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: He who cannot change the very fabric of his thought will never be able to change reality.
author: Anwar Sadat

quote: It is in the uncompromisingness with which dogma is held  and not in the dogma or want of dogma  that the danger lies.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: I wish to say what I think and feel today  with the proviso that tomorrow perhaps I shall contradict it all.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Progress is impossible without change  and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The most significant change in a person's life is a change of attitude. Right attitudes produce right actions.
author: William J. Johnston

quote: You had better be ready to change your mind when needed  or your mind will change you.
author: Henry B. Wilson

quote: The most fatal illusion is the settled point of view. Since life is growth and motion  a fixed point of view kills anybody who has one.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: The world does not have to change.... The only thing that has to change is our attitude.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: Oh  would that my mind could let fall its dead ideas  as the tree does its withered leaves!
author: Andre Gide

quote: Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A foolish consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds  adored by little statesmen and philosophers and divines.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong  which is but saying ... that he is wiser today than yesterday.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: We have to live today by what truth we can get today and be ready tomorrow to call it falsehood.
author: William James

quote: It is well for people who think to change their minds occasionally in order to keep them clean. For those who do not think  it is best at least to rearrange their prejudices once in a while.
author: Luther Burbank

quote: New opinions are always suspected  and usually opposed  without any other reason but because they are not already common.
author: John Locke

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well then  I contradict myself (I am large  I contain multitudes).
author: Walt Whitman

quote: I shall try to correct errors when shown to be errors  and I shall adopt new views so fast as they shall appear to be new views.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Contradiction is not a sign of falsity  nor the lack of contradiction a sign of truth.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: My opinion is a view I hold until... well  until I find something that changes it.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: He that never changes his opinions  and never corrects his mistakes  will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: Inconsistency is the only thing in which men are consistent.
author: Horatio Smith

quote: There is nothing in this world constant but inconstancy.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Consistency is only suitable for ridicule.
author: Moliere

quote: The world is quite right. It does not have to be consistent.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: The world's a scene of changes  and to be constant  in nature  is inconstancy.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: We cannot remain consistent with the world save by growing inconsistent with our past selves.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The world is quite right. It does not have to be consistent.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: True consistency  that of the prudent and the wise  is to act in conformity with circumstances  and not to act always the same way under a change of circumstances.
author: John C. Calhoun

quote: Consistency is a paste jewel that only cheap men cherish.
author: William Allen White

quote: Consistency requires you to be as ignorant today as you were a year ago.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Consistency is contrary to nature  contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are the dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There are those who would misteach us that to stick in a rut is consistency  and a virtue  and that to climb out of the rut is inconsistency  and a vice.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Too much consistency is as bad for the mind as for the body.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: With consistency a great soul has simply nothing to do. ... Speak what you think today in words as hard as cannon balls  and tomorrow speak what tomorrow thinks in hard words again  though it contradicts everything you said today.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: People who honestly mean to be true really contradict themselves much more rarely than those who try to be "consistent."
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To be honest  one must be inconsistent.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: The only man who can't change his mind is a man who hasn't got one.
author: Edward Noyes Westcott

quote: Like all weak men  he laid an exaggerated stress on not changing one's mind.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Nothing should be permanent except struggle with the dark side within ourselves.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinion.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The circumstances of the world are so variable that an irrevocable purpose or opinion is almost synonymous with a foolish one.
author: William H. Seward

quote: If in the last few years you haven't discarded a major opinion or acquired a new one  check your pulse. You may be dead.
author: Gelett Burgess

quote: A stiff attitude is one of the phenomena of rigor mortis.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: Those who never retract their opinions love themselves more than they love truth.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: It's the most unhappy people who most fear change.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Obstinacy and heat in sticking to one's opinions is the surest proof of stupidity. Is there anything so cocksure  so immovable  so disdainful  so contemplative  so solemn and serious as an ass?
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water  and breeds reptiles of the mind.
author: William Blake

quote: When people are least sure  they are often most dogmatic.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: A conclusion is a place where you got tired of thinking.
author: Fischer's Law

quote: Only fools and dead men don't change their minds. Fools won't. Dead men can't.
author: John H. Patterson

quote: The consistent thinker ... is either a walking mummy or else  if he has not succeeded in stifling all his vitality  a fanatical monomaniac.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Life is not a static thing. The only people who do not change their minds are incompetents in asylums  and those in cemeteries.
author: Everett M. Dirksen

quote: To hold the same views at forty as we held at twenty is to have been stupefied for a score of years and to take rank  not as a prophet  but as an unteachable brat  well birched and none the wiser.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: To do things today exactly the way you did them yesterday saves thinking.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Any change  even a change for the better  is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: Old habits are strong and jealous.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Every new truth begins in a shocking heresy.
author: Margaret Deland

quote: Birth is violent  whether it be the birth of a child or the birth of an idea.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Any truth creates a scandal.
author: Marguerite Yourcenar

quote: Even in slight things the experience of the new is rarely without some stirring of foreboding.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Change is not made without inconvenience  even from worse to better.
author: Richard Hooker

quote: All changes  even the most longed for  have their melancholy  for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves  we must die to one life before we can enter into another.
author: Anatole France

quote: The key to change ... is to let go of fear.
author: Rosanne Cash

quote: Tears are sometimes an inappropriate response to death. When a life has been lived completely honestly  completely successfully  or just completely  the correct response to death's perfect punctuation mark is a smile.
author: Julie Burchill

quote: Since changes are going on anyway  the great thing is to learn enough about them so that we will be able to lay hold of them and turn them in the direction of our desires. Condi-tions and events are neither to be fled from nor passively acquiesced in  they are to be utilized and directed.
author: John Dewey

quote: He that has energy enough to root out a vice should go further  and try to plant a virtue in its place.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: To change skins  evolve into new cycles  I feel one has to learn to discard. If one changes internally  one should not continue to live with the same objects. They reflect one's mind and psyche of yesterday. I throw away what has no dynamic  living use.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Today changes must come fast  and we must adjust our mental habits  so that we can accept comfortably the idea of stopping one thing and beginning another overnight.... We must assume that there is probably a better way to do almost everything. We must stop assuming that a thing which has never been done before probably cannot be done at all.
author: Donald M. Nelson

quote: We must therefore take account of this changeable nature of things and of human institutions  and prepare for them with enlightened foresight.
author: Pope Pius XI

quote: You don't have to be afraid of change. You don't have to worry about what's being taken away. Just look to see what's been added.
author: Jackie Greer

quote: When you're stuck in a spiral  to change all aspects of the spin you need only to change one thing.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: The first step toward change is acceptance. Once you accept yourself  you open the door to change. That's all you have to do. Change is not something you do  it's something you allow.
author: Will Garcia

quote: The more things change  the more they remain the same.
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: Things good in themselves ... perfectly valid in the integrity of their origins  become fetters if they cannot alter.
author: Freya Stark

quote: Change lays her hand not upon the truth.
author: Algernon Swinburne

quote: The spectacle has changed  but our eyes remain the same.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Change is the constant  the signal for rebirth  the egg of the phoenix.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: Change is what people fear most.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: Change means the unknown.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Nature's mighty law is change.
author: Robert Burns

quote: A human being does not cease to exist at death. It is change  not destruction  which takes place.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: The old order changeth yielding place to new  and God fulfills himself in many ways.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: The only people in the world who can change things are those who can sell ideas.
author: Lois Wyse

quote: Everybody thinks of changing humanity and nobody thinks of changing himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One person's constant is another person's variable.
author: Susan Gerhart

quote: The mill wheel turns  it turns forever  though what is uppermost remains not so.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: It's a bad plan that can't be changed.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: In a way  winter is the real spring  the time when the inner things happen  the resurge of nature.
author: Edna O'Brien

quote: Mourning is not forgetting. ... It is an undoing. Every minute tie has to be untied and something permanent and valuable recovered and assimilated from the dust.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: It is never any good dwelling on goodbyes. It is not the being together that it prolongs  it is the parting.
author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

quote: Such is the state of life that none are happy but by the anticipation of change. The change itself is nothing. When we have made it  the next wish is to change again.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: New links must be forged as old ones rust.
author: Jane Howard

quote: The hearts of great men can be changed.
author: Homer

quote: You cannot step twice into the same river  for other waters are continually flowing on.
author: Heraclitus

quote: A man's fortune must first be changed from within.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: There is danger in reckless change  but greater danger in blind conservatism.
author: Henry George

quote: Without imagination  nothing is dangerous.
author: Georgette Leblanc

quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life-specifically the fear of change. ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back. ...
author: Erica Jong

quote: As we learn we always change  and so our perception. This changed perception then becomes a new Teacher inside each of us.
author: Hyemeyohsts Storm

quote: We are restless because of incessant change  but we would be frightened if change were stopped.
author: Lyman Lloyd Bryson

quote: One must be thrust out of a finished cycle in life  and that leap is the most difficult to make-to part with one's faith  one's love  when one would prefer to renew the faith and recreate the passion.
author: Anais Nin

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: If you want to make enemies  try to change something.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: God  grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change  the courage to change the things I can  and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Whenever man comes up with a better mousetrap  nature immediately comes up with a better mouse.
author: James Carswell

quote: Musical comedies aren't written  they are re-written.
author: Stephen Sondheim

quote: I see the playwright as a lay preacher peddling the ideas of his time in popular form.
author: August Strindberg

quote: The art of creation is older than the art of killing.
author: Andrei Voznesensky

quote: Human Salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: In the creative state a man is taken out of himself. He lets down as it were a bucket into his subconscious  and draws up something which is normally beyond his reach. He mixes this thing with his normal experiences and out of the mixture he makes a work of art.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: I do not seek. I find.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The life of the creative man is led  directed and controlled by boredom. Avoiding boredom is one of our most important purposes.
author: Saul Steinberg

quote: An artist is a creature driven by demons. He doesn't know why they choose him and he's usually too busy to wonder why.
author: William Faulkner

quote: No artist is ahead of his time. He is his time. It is just that others are behind the time.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Doodling is the brooding of the hand.
author: Saul Steinberg

quote: I am a choreographer. A choreographer is a poet. I do not create. God creates. I assemble  and I will steal from everywhere to do it.
author: George Balanchine

quote: Workaholics are energized rather than enervated by their work - their energy paradoxically expands as it is expended.
author: Marilyn Machlowitz

quote: You lose it if you talk about it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: In creating  the only hard thing's to begin  A grass-blade's no easier to make than an oak.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I can always be distracted by love  but eventually I get horny for my creativity.
author: Gilda Radner

quote: The End of every maker is himself.
author: St. Thomas Aquinas

quote: Now I really make the little idea from clay  and I hold it in my hand. I can turn it  look at it from underneath  see it from one view  hold it against the sky  imagine it any size I like  and really be in control  almost like God creating something.
author: Henry Moore

quote: No matter how old you get  if you can keep the desire to be creative  you're keeping the man-child alive.
author: John Cassavetes

quote: What is originality? Undetected plagiarism.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: Originality is nothing but judicious imitation.
author: Voltaire

quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
author: Frank Capra

quote: Style is a simple way of saying complicated things.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: What another would have done as well as you  do not do it. What another would have said as well as you  do not say it. What another would have written as well  do not write it. Be faithful to that which exists nowhere but in yourself- and thus make yourself indispensable.
author: Andre Gide

quote: It seems that the creative faculty and the critical faculty cannot exist together in their highest perfection.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: I must create a system or be enslaved by another man's. I will not reason and compare  My business is to create.
author: William Blake

quote: In the beginning God created the Heaven and the earth. And the earth was without form  and void  and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters. And God said  Let there be light  and there was light.
author: Bible

quote: Nature they say  doth dote  And cannot make a man Save on some worn-out plan  Repeating us by rote.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: All are but parts of one stupendous whole  Whose body Nature is  and God the soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: It is easier to suppose that the universe has existed from all eternity than to conceive a Being beyond its limits capable of creating it.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The world embarrasses me  and I cannot dream That this watch exists and has no watchmaker.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is in the world  or nowhere  creating continually in us and around us. Insofar as man partakes of this creative process does he partake of the divine  of God  and that participation is his immortality ....
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: You were placed on this earth to create  not to compete.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: Every moment of your life is infinitely creative and the universe is endlessly bountiful. )ust put forth a clear enough request  and everything your heart truly desires must come to you.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: There is no greater joy than that of feeling oneself a creator. The triumph of life is expressed by creation.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: Creativity is a central source of meaning in our lives . . . most of the things that are interesting  important  and human are the results of creativity . . . when we are involved in it  we feel that we are living more fully than during the rest of life.
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

quote: Creativeness often consists of merely turning up what is already there.
author: Bernice Fitz-Gibbon

quote: A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something.
author: Frank Capra

quote: I saw an angel in the block of marble and I just chiseled 'til I set him free.
author: Michelangelo

quote: In creating  the only hard thing's to begin  A grass-blade's no easier to make than an oak.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: No matter how old you get  if you can keep the desire to be creative  you're keeping the man-child alive.
author: John Cassavetes

quote: It is the child in man that is the source of his uniqueness and creativeness  and the playground is the optimal milieu for the unfolding of his capacities.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Many times we will get more ideas and better ideas in two hours of creative loafing than in eight hours at a desk.
author: Wilfred Peterson

quote: If you are seeking creative ideas  go out walking. Angels whisper to a man when he goes for a walk.
author: Raymond Inman

quote: In God we trust  all others must pay cash.
author: American Saying

quote: He that hath lost his credit is dead to the world.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: No man's credit is as good as his money.
author: E. W. Howe

quote: Ah  take the cash  and let the credit go.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Better be too credulous than too skeptical
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Let us believe neither half of the good people tell us of ourselves  nor half the evil they say of others.
author: J. Pettit-Senn

quote: I wish I was as sure of anything as Macaulay is of everything.
author: William Windham

quote: A small demerit extinguishes a long service.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: And the thing has been said and said well  have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
author: Anatole France

quote: Jupiter is slow looking into his notebook  but he always looks.
author: Zenobius

quote: The number of malefactors authorizes not the crime.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: No one is entirely useless. Even the worst of us can serve as horrible examples.
author: Anonymous prisoner

quote: The faults of the burglar are the qualities of the financier.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: He who excuses himself accuses himself. (Qui s'excuse  s'accuse.)
author: Anonymous

quote: The study of crime begins with the knowledge of oneself.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Fear succeeds crime - it is its punishment.
author: Voltaire

quote: All punishment is mischief. All punishment in itself is evil.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Speaking generally  punishment hardens and numbs  it produces concentration  it sharpens the consciousness of alienation  it strengthens the power of resistance.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He only may chastise who loves.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: If England treats her criminals the way she has treated me  she doesn't deserve to have any.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: It is fairly obvious that those who are in favour of the death penalty have more affinity with assassins than those who are not.
author: Remy de Gourmont

quote: Prisons don't rehabilitate  they don't punish  they don't protect  so what the hell do they do?
author: Jerry Brown

quote: Capital punishment is as fundamentally wrong as a cure for crime as charity is wrong as a cure for poverty.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The reformative effect of punishment is a belief that dies hard  chiefly  I think  because it is so satisfying to our sadistic impulses.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Much as he is opposed to lawbreaking  he is not bigoted about it.
author: Damon Runyon

quote: Crime  like virtue  has its degrees.
author: Racine

quote: Society prepares the crime  the criminal commits it.
author: Henry Thomas Buckle

quote: Many commit the same crimes with a very different result. One bears a cross for his crime  another a crown.
author: Juvenal

quote: One crime is everything  two nothing.
author: Dorothee Deluzy

quote: Whoever profits by the crime is guilty of it.
author: French proverb

quote: It is not the thief who is hanged  but one who was caught stealing.
author: Czech proverb

quote: We enact many laws that manufacture criminals  and then a few that punish them.
author: Abraham Tucker

quote: Yet each man kills the thing he loves  By each let this be heard  Some do it with a bitter look  Some with a flattering word  The coward does it with a kiss  The brave man with a sword.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When written in Chinese  the word crisis is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's this day-to-day living that wears you out.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Winston has written four volumes about himself and called it 'World Crisis'.
author: Arthur Balfour

quote: Poetry is the language of a state of crisis.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: There is no crisis to which academics will not respond with a seminar.
author: Old saying

quote: Faced with crisis  the man of character falls back on himself.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: The crisis of today is the joke of tomorrow.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: The crisis you have to worry about most is the one you don't see coming.
author: Mike Mansfield

quote: So when the crisis is upon you  remember that God  like a trainer of wrestlers  has matched you with a tough and stalwart antagonist... that you may prove a victor at the Great Games.
author: Epictetus

quote: Said the pot to die kettle  "Get away  blackface."
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Critics are the men who have failed in literature and art.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: As a bankrupt thief turns thief-taker in despair  so an unsuccessful author turns critic.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: What a blessed thing it is that nature  when she invented  manufactured and patented her audiors  contrived to make critics out of the chips that were left!
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Even the lion has to defend himself against flies.
author: German proverb

quote: I had rather be hissed for a good verse than applauded for a bad one.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world -  though the cant of hypocrites ihay be the worst - the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: A guest sees more in an hour than the host in a year.
author: Polish proverb

quote: Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamppost how it feels about dogs.
author: Christopher Hampton

quote: Book reviewers are little old ladies of both sexes.
author: John O'Hara

quote: Constant  indiscriminate approval devalues because it is so predictable.
author: Kit Reed

quote: Critics are biased  and so are readers. (Indeed  a critic is a bundle of biases held loosely together by a sense of taste.) But intelligent readers soon discover how to allow for the windage of their own and a critic's prejudices.
author: Whitney Balliett

quote: Don't judge any man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
author: American Indian saying

quote: Henry James chews more than he bites off.
author: Mrs. Henry Adams

quote: I don't want to see the uncut version of anything.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: It is easy - terribly easy - to shake a man's faith in himself. To take advantage of that  to break a man's spirit is devil's work.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The critic is an overgoer with pen-envy.
author: Geoffrey Hartman

quote: Two and two continue to make four  in spite of the whine of the amateur for three  or the cry of the critic for five.
author: James McNeill Whistler

quote: Tomorrow night I appear for the first time before a Boston audience - 4000 critics.
author: Mark Twain

quote: He has a right to criticize  who has a heart to help.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: More and more people think of the critic as an indispensable middle man between writer and reader  and would no more read a book alone  if they could help it  than have a baby alone.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: It is not expected of critics that they should help us to make sense of our lives  they are bound only to attempt the lesser feat of making sense of the ways we try to make sense of our lives.
author: Frank Kermode

quote: Analysis kills spontaneity. The grain once ground into flour springs and germinates no more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: His words leap across rivers and mountains  but his thoughts are still only six inches long.
author: E. B. White

quote: When critics disagree  the artist is in accord with himself.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The factor in human life provocative of a noble discontent is the gradual emergence of a sense of criticism  founded upon appreciation of beauty  and of intellectual distinction  and of duty.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: To many people dramatic criticism must seem like an attempt to tattoo soap bubbles.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: The test of a good critic is whether he knows when and how to believe on insufficient evidence.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Reprove not a scorner  lest he hate thee  rebuke a wise man and he will love thee.
author: Bible

quote: In judging others  folks will work overtime for no pay.
author: Charles Edwin Carruthers

quote: A critic is a man who knows the way but can't drive the car.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: If you are willing to take the punishment  you're halfway through the battle. That the issues may be trivial  the battle ugly  is another point.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: A critic is a legless man who teaches running.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: Vilify! Vilify! Some of it will always stick.
author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quote: Always bring money along with your complaints.
author: Plautus

quote: Nature fits all her children with something to do He who would write and can't write  can surely review.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Nature  when she invented  manufactured and patented her authors  contrived to make critics out of the chips that were left.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To escape criticism - do nothing  say nothing  be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Any fool can criticize  and many of them do.
author: Archbishop C. Garbett

quote: Critics are like eunuchs in a harem: they know how it's done  they've seen it done every day  but they're unable to do it themselves.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: I am sitting in the smallest room in my house. I have your review in front of me. Soon it will be behind me.
author: Max Reger

quote: The good critic is he who narrates the adventures of his soul among masterpieces.
author: Anatole France

quote: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world  tho' the cant of hypocrites may be the worst  the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: The critic is the duenna in the passionate affair between playwrights  actors and audiences - a figure dreaded  and occasionally comic  but never welcome  never loved.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: A critic at best is a waiter at the great table of literature.
author: Louis Dudek

quote: In Heaven an angel is nobody in particular.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The mob has many heads but no brains.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A myth is a fixed way of looking at the world which cannot be destroyed because  looked at through the myth  all evidence supports that myth.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Insanity in individuals is rare - but in groups  parties  nations  and epochs  it is the rule.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Every crowd has a silver lining.
author: P. T. Barnum

quote: When a hundred men stand together  each of them loses his mind and gets another one.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Wherever there is a crowd there is untruth.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: The time when  most of all  you should withdraw into yourself is when you are forced to be in a crowd.
author: Epicurus

quote: You cannot make a man by standing a sheep on its hind legs. But by standing a flock of sheep in that position you can make a crowd of men.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: The average man's opinions are much less foolish than they would be if he thought for himself.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Man's inhumanity to man Makes countless thousands mourn!
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: It is not linen you're wearing out  But human creatures' lives.
author: Thomas Hood

quote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

quote: I must be cruel  only to be kind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Culture  with us  ends in headache.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Reading makes a full man  conference a ready man  and writing an exact man.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Culture is what your butcher would have if he were a surgeon.
author: Mary Pettibone Poole

quote: Curiosity killed the cat.
author: American Proverb

quote: Ask me no questions  and I'll tell you no fibs.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Other times  other customs.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Ancient custom has the force of law.
author: Legal maxim

quote: Custom is the law of fools.
author: Sir John Vanbrugh

quote: A cynic is not merely one who reads bitter lessons from the past  he is one who is prematurely disappointed in the future.
author: Sidney J. Harris

quote: Cynicism is humour in ill health.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Cynicism such as one finds very frequently among the most highly educated young men and women of the West  results from the combination of comfort and powerlessness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A cynic is a man who  when he smells flowers  looks around for a coffin.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Cynicism - the intellectual cripple's substitute for intelligence.
author: Russell Lynes

quote: Cynicism is that blackguard defect of vision which compels us to see the world as it is  instead of as it should be.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Cynicism is intellectual dandyism  without the coxcomb's feathers.
author: George Meredith

quote: There is nothing to which men  while they have food and drink  cannot reconcile themselves.
author: George Santayana

quote: It's not that the Irish are cynical. It's rather that they have a wonderful lack of respect for everything and everybody.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: Watch what people are cynical about  and one can often discover what they lack.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A cynic can chill and dishearten with a single word.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We can destroy ourselves by cynicism and disillusion just as effectively as by bombs.
author: Kenneth Clark

quote: Cynicism is an unpleasant way of saying the truth.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything  and the value of nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The cynic is one who never sees a good quality in a man  and never fails to see a bad one. He is the human owl  vigilant in darkness and blind to light  mousing for vermin  and never seeing noble game. The cynic puts all human actions into two classes - openly bad and secretly bad.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: On with the dance! Let joy be unconfin'd  No sleep till morn  when Youth and Pleasure meet.
author: Lord Byron

quote: No man in his senses will dance.
author: Cicero

quote: Come and trip it as ye go  On the light fantastic toe.
author: John Milton

quote: They who love dancing too much seem to have more brains in their feet than in their head.
author: Terence

quote: We triumph without glory when we conquer without danger.
author: Corneille

quote: Danger for danger's sake is senseless.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: The pitcher that goes too often to the well is broken at last.
author: Enclish Proverb

quote: A timid person is frightened before a danger  a coward during the time  and a courageous person afterwards.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: No one reaches a high position without daring.
author: Syrus

quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
author: Charles A. Beard

quote: A blind man in a dark room - looking for a black hat which isn't there.
author: Lord Bowen

quote: Darkness is strong  and so is Sin  But surely God endures forever!
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Fear is the dark room in which negatives are developed.
author: Anonymous

quote: Even a small star shines in the darkness.
author: Finnish proverb

quote: It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
author: Corita Kent

quote: The dreadful dead of dark midnight.
author: William Shakespeare

author: Chinese proverb

quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
author: Corita Kent

quote: The dreadful dead of dark midnight.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It is always darkest just before .the day dawneth.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: My son is my son till he have got him a wife  But my daughter's my daughter all the days of her life.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: If thy daughter marry well  thou hast found a son  if not  thou hast lost a daughter.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Tis of the tears which stars weep  sweet with joy.
author: Francis Bailey

quote: Every dew-drop and raindrop had a whole heaven within it.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Think that day lost whose (low) descending sun Views from thy hand no noble action done.
author: Jacob Bobart

quote: For mem'ry has painted this perfect day. With colors that never fade  And we find at the end of a perfect day  The soul of a friend we've made
author: Carrie Jacobs Bond

quote: What a day may bring a day may take away.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Monday for wealth  Tuesday for health  Wednesday the best day of all: Thursday for crosses  Friday for losses  Saturday no luck at all.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: One glance of Thine creates a day.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: Death twitches my ear. "Live " he says  "I am coming".
author: Justice Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To die is a debt we must all of us discharge.
author: Euripides

quote: Here lies Jack Williams. He done his damndest.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: As long as I have a want  I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: For death begins with life's first breath And life begins at touch of death.
author: John Oxenham

quote: As men  we are all equal in the presence of death.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: At last God caught his eye.
author: Harry Secombe

quote: Death - the last voyage  the longest  the best.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: Death is a delightful hiding-place for weary men.
author: Herodotus

quote: Death is just a distant rumour to the young.
author: Andy Roomy

quote: For three days after death  hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: He mourns the dead who lives as they desire.
author: Edward Young

quote: He that dies pays all debts.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Honest listening is one of the best medicines we can offer the dying and the bereaved.
author: Jean Cameron

quote: I believe that the struggle against death  the unconditional and self-willed determination to live  is the mode of power behind the lives and activities of all outstanding men.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: I care not  a man can die but once  we owe God a death.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I had a lover's quarrel with the world.
author: Robert Frost

quote: In Heaven  all the interesting people are missing.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: In Spain  the dead are more alive than the dead of any other country in the world.
author: Fedirico Garcia Lorca

quote: It is a far  far better thing that I do  than anything I have ever done  it is a far  far  better rest that I go to  than I have ever known.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Man comes and tills the field and lies beneath  And after many a summer dieth the swan.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: It may be that we have all lived before and died  and this is Hell.
author: A. L. Prusick

quote: If there is another world  he lives in bliss. If there is none  he made the best of this.
author: Robert Burns

quote: Most persons have died before they expired - died to all earthly longings  so that the last breath is only  as it were  the locking of the door of the already deserted mansion.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: One short sleep past will wake eternally And death shall be no more  Death thou shalt die.
author: John Donne

quote: Rather suffer than die is man's motto.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: The art of living well and the art of dying well are one.
author: Epicurus

quote: The only truly dead are those who have been forgotten.
author: Jewish saying

quote: The question is whether suicide is the way out  or the way in.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: When you have told anyone you have left him a legacy  the only decent thing to do is to die at once.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: I will be dead in a few months. But it hasn't given me the slightest anxiety or worry. I always knew I was going to die.
author: B. F. Skinner

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night Old age should burn and rave at close of day  Rage  rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: The stroke of death is as a lover's pinch  Which hurts and is desired.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nothing in his life Became him like the leaving it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Things have a terrible permanence when people die.
author: Joyce Kilmer

quote: A solemn funeral is inconceivable to the Chinese mind.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: At its most basic root  the death or disintegration of one's parents is a harsh reminder of one's own mortality.
author: Janet Harris

quote: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work. I want to achieve immortality through not dying.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Mausoleum  n: the final and funniest folly of the rich.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: No  'tis not so deep as a well  nor so wide as a church door  but 'tis enough  'twill serve: ask for me tomorrow  and you shall find me a grave man. I am peppered  I warrant  for this world.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Epitaph  n: an inscription on a tomb showing that virtues acquired by death have a retroactive effect.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Human life consists in mutual service. No grief  pain  misfortune  or 'broken heart' is excuse for cutting off one's life while any power of service remains. But when all usefulness is over  when one is assured of an unavoidable and imminent death  it is the simplest of human rights to choose a quick and easy death in place of a slow and horrible one.
author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quote: Poisons pain you  Rivers are damp  Acid stains you  And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful  Nooses give  Gas smells awful  You might as well live.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Dying is a wild night and a new road.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The reports of my death are greatly exaggerated.
author: Mark Twain

quote: And I looked  and behold  a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death.
author: Bible

quote: There is no man so blessed that some who stand by his deathbed won't hail the occasion with delight.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: There may be little or much beyond the grave  But the strong are saying nothing until they see.
author: Robert Frost

quote: All human things are subject to decay And when fate summons  monarchs must obey.
author: John Dryden

quote: When Andrew Jackson died someone asked a friend if he thought Old Hickory would go to heaven. 'He will if he wants to ' was the reply. On his death bed Disraeli declined a visit from Queen Victoria. 'No  it is better not'  he said  'she would only ask me to take a message to Albert.' I am a broken machine. I am ready to go.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Let the tent be struck.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: You can lose a man like that by your own death  but not by his.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Because I could not stop for Death He kindly stopped for me - The carriage held but just ourselves And Immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: When a man dies  he does not just die of the disease he has: he dies of his whole life.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: The long habit of living indisposeth us for dying.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: Most people would die sooner than think  in fact  they do.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: One should be ever booted and spurred and ready to depart.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Who never caused others to die Seldom rates a statue.
author: Anonymous

quote: Nothing you can lose by dying is half so precious as the readiness to die  which is man's charter of nobility.
author: George Santayana

quote: After sixty years the stern sentence of the burial service seems to have a meaning that one did not notice in former years. There begins to be something personal about it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Death be not proud  though some have called Thee Mighty and dreadful  for thou art not so.
author: John Donne

quote: Toward the person who has died we adopt a special attitude: something like admiration for someone who has accomplished a very difficult task.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: You have to learn to do everything  even to die.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: I'm not afraid to die. I just don't want to be there when it happens.
author: Woody Allen
