quote: Oh death  you can wait  keep your distance.
author: Andre Chenier

quote: Body and mind  like man and wife  do not always agree to die together.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The undiscovered country from whose bourn no traveller returns.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A thousand goodbyes come after death - the first six months of bereavement.
author: Alan Gregg

quote: You don't die in the United States  you underachieve.
author: Jerzy Kosinski

quote: Life is a great surprise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: If life must not be taken too seriously - then so neither must death.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Death is terrible to Cicero  desirable to Cato  and indifferent to Socrates.
author: Anonymous

quote: In nature  there is less death and destruction than death and transmutation.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: A man's dying is more the survivors' affair than his own.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: I hate funerals  and would not attend my Own if it could be avoided  but it is well for every man to stop once in a while to think of what sort of a collection of mourners he is training for his final event.
author: Robert T. Morris

quote: If this is dying  I don't think much of it.
author: Lytton Strachey

quote: Men use one another to assure their personal victory over death.
author: Ernest Becker

quote: Any man's death diminishes me  because I am involved in mankind  and therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls  it tolls for thee.
author: John Donne

quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumour  and survival a thing not beyond the bounds of possibility.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: I cannot forgive my friends for dying: I do not find these vanishing acts of theirs at all amusing.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Make sure to send a lazy man for the Angel of Death.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: It cost me never a stab nor squirm To tread by chance upon a worm. 'Aha  my little dear' I say  'Your clan will pay me back one day.'
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Around  around the sun we go: The moon goes round the earth. We do not die of death: We die of vertigo.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: There is no such thing as death  In nature  nothing dies: From each sad moment of decay Some forms of life arise.
author: Charles Mackay

quote: I am going to seek a great Perhaps.
author: Frangois Rabelais

quote: Call no man happy till he is dead.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Though this may be play to you  Tis death to us.
author: Aesop

quote: Earth to earth  ashes to ashes  dust to dust  in sure and certain hope of the resurrection.
author: Anonymous

quote: In the midst of life we are in death.
author: Anonymous

quote: Man that is born of a woman hath but a short time to live  and is full of misery. He cometh up  and is cut down  like a flower  he fleeth as it were a shadow  and never continueth in one stay.
author: Anonymous

quote: Death  so called  is a thing which makes men weep  And yet a third of life is pass'd in sleep.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Why fear death? It is the most beautiful adventure in life.
author: Charles Frohman

quote: Now I am about to take my last voyage  a great leap in the dark.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Is death the last sleep? No  it is the last final awakening.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The Lord gave  and the Lord hath taken away  blessed be the name of the Lord.
author: Anonymous

quote: We begin to die as soon as we are born  and the end is linked to the beginning.
author: Marcus Manilius

quote: There is no death! the stars go down To rise upon some other shore  And bright in Heaven's jeweled crown  They shine for ever more.
author: John L. McCreery

quote: Strange - is it not? - that of the myriads who Before us passed the door of Darkness through  Not one returns to tell us of the road Which to discover we must travel too.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: I am dying  Egypt  dying.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Yet a little sleep  a little slumber  a little folding of the hands to sleep.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have a rendezvous with Death At some disputed barricade.
author: Alan Seecer

quote: Till tired  he sleeps  and life's poor play is o'er.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: To die: - to sleep: No more  and  by a sleep to say we end The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to  'tis a consummation Devoutly to be wished.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nothing in his life Became him like the leaving it.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Death lies on her  like an untimely frost Upon the sweetest flower of all the field.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: First our pleasures die - and then Our hopes  and then our fears - and when These are dead  the debt is due  Dust claims dust - and we die too.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: God's finger touched him  and he slept.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Sunset and evening star  And one clear call for me! And may there be no moaning of the bar When I put out to sea.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: For he who lives more lives than one More deaths than one must die.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A church debt is the devil's salary.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Wilt thou seal up the avenues of ill? Pay every debt as if God wrote the bill!
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If you want the time to pass quickly  just give your note for 90 days.
author: R. B. Thomas

quote: Owe no man anything.
author: Romans

quote: He that dies pays all debts.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A national debt  if it is not excessive  will be to us a national blessing.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Debt is the worst poverty.
author: M. G. Lichtwer

quote: Hood an ass with reverend purple. So you can hide his two ambitious ears  and he shall pass for a cathedral doctor.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Proportion is almost impossible to human beings. There is no one who does not exaggerate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Everything that deceives may be said to enchant.
author: Plato

quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
author: Goethe

quote: All charming people have something to conceal  usually their total dependence on the appreciation of others.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: You k'n hide de fier  but what you guine do wid de smoke?
author: Joel Chandler Harris

quote: Deep versed in books and shallow in himself.
author: John Milton

quote: Half the work that is done in the world is to make things appear what they are not.
author: E. R. Beadle

quote: What we need is a rebirth of satire  of dissent  of irreverence  of an uncompromising insistence that phoniness is phony and platitudes are platitudinous.
author: Arthur Schlesinger

quote: If the world will be gulled  let it be gulled.
author: Robert Burton

quote: I give you bitter pills in sugar coating. The pills are harmless: the poison is in the sugar.
author: Stanislaw Lee

quote: I have known a vast quantity of nonsense talked about bad men not looking you in the face. Don't trust that conventional idea. Dishonesty will stare honesty out of countenance  any day in the week  if there is anything to be got by it.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: One should seek for the salutary in the unpleasant: if it is there  it is after all nectar. One should seek for the deceitful in the pleasant: if it is there it is after all poison.
author: Panchatantra

quote: Deceive not thy physician  confessor  nor lawyer.
author: George Herbert

quote: Frank and explicit - this is the right line to take when you wish to conceal your own mind and to confuse the mind of others.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A delusion  a mockery  and a snare.
author: Lord Denman

quote: We are never deceived  we deceive ourselves.
author: Goethe

quote: Which I wish to remark  -  And my language is plain  -  That for ways that are dark And for tricks that are vain  The heathen Chinese is peculiar.
author: Bret Harte

quote: Hateful to me as are the gates of hell  Is he who  hiding one thing in his heart  Utters another.
author: Homer

quote: You can fool some of the people all of the time  and all of the people some of the time  but you cannot fool all of the people all the time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: It is double pleasure to deceive the deceiver.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: "Will you walk into my parlour?" Said the spider to a fly: '"Tis the prettiest little parlour That ever you did spy."
author: Mary Howitt

quote: One is easily fooled by that which one loves.
author: Moliere

quote: Men and women everywhere must exercise deliberate selection to live wisely.
author: Robert Grant

quote: Decision and determination are the engineer and fireman of our train to opportunity and success.
author: Burt Lawlor

quote: The last of the human freedoms: to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances  to choose one's own way.
author: Viktor Frankl

quote: Choice of attention ... is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer. In both cases  a man is responsible for his choice and must accept the consequences  whatever they may be.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: You are the one who must choose your place.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: Man does not simply exist  but always decides what his existence will be  what he will become in the next moment.
author: Viktor Frankl

quote: Full maturity ... is achieved by realizing that you have choices to make.
author: Angela Barron McBride

quote: Wherever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Life is just a series of trying to make up your mind.
author: Timothy Fuller

quote: Life is just an endless chain of judgements. . . . The more imperfect our judgement  the less perfect our success.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: To know just what has do be done  then to do it  comprises the whole philosophy of practical life.
author: Sir William Osier

quote: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism  the way you play it is free will.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Living is a constant process of deciding what we are going to do.
author: Jose Ortega

quote: Life is the sum of all your choices.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: The difficulty of life is in the choice.
author: George Moore

quote: The strongest principle of growth lies in human choice.
author: George Eliot

quote: As a man thinketh  so is he  and as a man chooseth  so is he.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Decisions determine destiny.
author: Frederick Speakman

quote: Choices are the hinges of destiny.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: Many of life's circumstances are created by three basic choices: the disciplines you choose to keep  the people you chose to be with  and the laws you choose to obey.
author: Charles Millhuff

quote: You don't get to choose how you're going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you're going to live. Now.
author: Joan Baez

quote: Look for your choices  pick the best one  then go with it.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Rules of society are nothing  one's conscience is the umpire.
author: Madame Dudevant

quote: No matter how lovesick a woman is  she shouldn't take the first pill that comes along.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Form the habit of making decisions when your spirit is fresh ... to let dark moods lead is like choosing cowards to command armies.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: One must either accept some theory or else believe one's own instinct or follow the world's opinion.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Decide which is the line of conduct that presents the fewest drawbacks and then follow it out as being the best one  because one never finds anything perfectly pure and unmixed  or exempt from danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: A problem clearly stated is a problem half solved.
author: Dorothea Brande

quote: We must make the choices that enable us to fulfill the deepest capacities of our real selves.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Choose always the way that seems the best  however rough it may be  custom will soon render it easy and agreeable.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Where an opinion is general  it is usually correct.
author: Jane Austen

quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions. But I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them  and make them right.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Once the "what" is decided  the "how" always follows. We must not make the "how" an excuse for not facing and accepting the "what."
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: In each action we must look beyond the action at our past  present and future state  and at others whom it affects  and see the relation of all those things. And then we shall be very cautious.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: One's mind has a way of making itself up in the background  and it suddenly becomes clear what one means to do.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: Not all of your decisions will be correct. None of us is perfect. But if you get into the habit of making decisions  experience will develop your judgment to a point where more and more of your decisions will be right. After all  it is better to be right 51 percent of the time and get something done  than it is to get nothing done because you fear to reach a decision.
author: H. W. Andrews

quote: Decide on what you think is right  and stick to it.
author: George Eliot

quote: Continually one faces the horrible matter of making decisions. The solution ... is  as far as possible  to avoid conscious rational decisions and choices  simply to do what you find yourself doing  to float in the great current of life with as little friction as possible  to allow things to settle themselves  as indeed they do with the most infallible certainty.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: When making a decision of minor importance  I have always found it advantageous to consider all the pros and cons. In vital matters  however  such as the choice of a mate or a profession  the decision should come from the unconscious  from somewhere within ourselves. In the important decisions of personal life  we should be governed  I think  by the deep inner needs of our nature.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Pick battles big enough to matter  small enough to win.
author: Jonathan Kozel

quote: Wisdom consists in being able to distinguish among dangers and make a choice of the least harmful.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Human foresight often leaves its proudest possessor only a choice of evils.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: When one bases his life on principle  99 percent of his decisions are already made.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best we can do is size up the chances  calculate the risks involved  estimate our ability to deal with them  and then make our plans with confidence.
author: Henry Ford

quote: In case of doubt  decide in favor of what is correct.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: Each man must for himself alone decide what is right and what is wrong  which course is patriotic and which isn't. You cannot shirk this and be a man. To decide against your conviction is to be an unqualified and inexcusable traitor  both to yourself and to your country  let men label you as they may.
author: Mark Twain

quote: People "died" all the time. ... Parts of them died when they made the wrong kinds of decisions-decisions against life. Sometimes they died bit by bit until finally they were just living corpses walking around. If you were perceptive you could see it in their eyes  the fire had gone out ... you always knew when you made a decision against life. ... The door clicked and you were safe inside- safe and dead.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: What I emphasize is for people to make choices based not on fear  but on what really gives them a sense of fulfillment.
author: Pauline Rose Chance

quote: We lose the fear of making decisions  great and small  as we realize that should our choice prove wrong we can  if we will  learn from the experience.
author: Bill W.

quote: History is a stern judge.
author: Svetlana Alliluyeva

quote: I get a little angry about this highhanded scrapping of the look of things. What else have we to go by? How else can the average person form an opinion of a girl's sense of values or even of her chastity except by the looks of her conduct?
author: Margaret Culkin Banning

quote: You wouldn't want to be caught wearing cheap perfume  would you? Then why do you want to wear cheap perfume on your conduct?
author: Margaret Culkin Banning

quote: The difference between weakness and wickedness is much less than people suppose  and the consequences are nearly always the same.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge  fitter to bruise than to polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: One faces the future with one's past.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Our deeds still travel with us from afar  and what we have been makes us what we are.
author: George Eliot

quote: You must not change one thing  one pebble  one grain of sand  until you know what good and evil will follow on that act.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: The beginning of compunction is the beginning of a new life.
author: George Eliot

quote: The Pilgrims didn't have any experience when they landed here. Hell  if experience was that important  we'd never have anybody walking on the moon.
author: Doug Rader

quote: Each person has a literature inside them. But when people lose language  when they have to experiment with putting their thoughts together on the spot-that's what I love most. That's where character lives.
author: Anna Deavere Smith

quote: There is no data on the future.
author: Laurel Cutler

quote: The most important fact about Spaceship Earth: an instruction book didn't come with it.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: Life is the only art that we are required to practice without preparation  and without being allowed the preliminary trials  the failures and botches  that are essential for the training of a mere beginner.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Time has told me less than I need to know.
author: Gwen Harwood

quote: I learn by going where I have to go.
author: Theodore Roethke

quote: Life is like playing a violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: We don't have enough time to premeditate all our actions.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Every year  if not every day  we have to wager our salvation upon some prophecy based upon imperfect knowledge.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: A decision is an action you must take when you have information so incomplete that the answer does not suggest itself.
author: Arthur Radford

quote: She knew in her heart that to be without optimism  that core of reasonless hope in the spirit  rather than the brain  was a fatal flaw  the seed of death.
author: Anne Perry

quote: When faith is supported by facts or by logic it ceases to be faith.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: How far would Moses have gone if he had taken a poll in Egypt?
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Better to be without logic than without feeling.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: The will to be totally rational is the will to be made out of glass and steel: and to use others as if they were glass and steel.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: In the three years I played ball  we won six  lost seventeen and tied two. Some statistician ... calculated that we won 75 percent of the games we didn't lose.
author: Roger M. Blough

quote: Imagination took the reins  and Reason  slow-paced  though surefooted  was unequal to a race with so eccentric and flighty a companion.
author: Fanny Burney

quote: Many persons of high intelligence have notoriously poor judgement.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: How dangerous can false reasoning prove!
author: Sophocles

quote: The tendency of modern science is to reduce proof to absurdity by continually reducing absurdity to proof.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Say you were standing with one foot in the oven and one foot in an ice bucket. According to the percentage people  you would be perfectly comfortable.
author: Bobby Bragan

quote: Logic is the art of going wrong with confidence.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Reason  with most people  means their own opinions.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Logic pervades the world  the limits of the world are also the limits of logic.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Man is a reasoning  rather than a reasonable  animal.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: False conclusions which have been reasoned out are infinitely worse than blind impulse.
author: Horace Mann

quote: If you do everything you should do  and do not do anything you should not do  you will  according to the best available statistics  live exactly eighteen hours longer than you would otherwise.
author: Dr. Logain Clendening

quote: Decisions  particularly important ones  have always made me sleepy  perhaps because I know that I will have to make them by instinct  and thinking things out is only what other people tell me I should do.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Statistics are no substitute for judgement.
author: Henry Clay

quote: It is the heart always that sees before the head can see.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Facts are stubborn things  but statistics are more pliable.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: A true history of human events would show that a far larger proportion of our acts are the result of sudden impulse and accident than of that reason of which we so much boast.
author: Peter Cooper

quote: It is always thus  impaled by a state of mind which is destined not to last  that we make our irrevocable decisions.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: A power greater than any human being helped make this decision.
author: Herbert J. Steifel

quote: He who reflects too much will achieve little.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The percentage of mistakes in quick decisions is no greater than in long-drawn-out vacillations  and the effect of decisiveness itself "makes things go" and creates confidence.
author: Anne O'Hare McCormick

quote: Deliberation often loses a good chance.
author: Latin proverb

quote: The mania of thinking renders one unfit for every activity.
author: Anatole France

quote: When possible make the decisions now  even if action is in the future. A revised decision usually is better than one reached at the last moment.
author: William B. Given

quote: We spend our days in deliberating  and we end them without coming to any resolve.
author: L'Estrange

quote: If you think too long  you think wrong.
author: Jim Kaat

quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
author: Bobby Murcer

quote: The soul of dispatch is decision.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The moment a question comes to your mind  see yourself mentally taking hold of it and disposing of it. In that moment... you learn to become the decider and not the vacillator. Thus you build character.
author: H. Van Anderson

quote: So what do we do? Anything. Something. So long as we just don't sit there. If we screw it up  start over. Try something else. If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
author: Harry A. Hopf

quote: Some persons are very decisive when it comes to avoiding decisions.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor the best opportunities  they will never come.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: There comes a time when you've got to say  "Let's get off our asses and go ..." I have always found that if I move with 75 percent or more of the facts I usually never regret it. It's the guys who wait to have everything perfect that drive you crazy.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
author: William Feather

quote: Common sense does not ask an impossible chessboard  but takes the one before it and plays the game.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: He who postpones the hour of living is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
author: Horace

quote: If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
author: Ben Nicholas

quote: Nothing at all will be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: It is the characteristic excellence of the strong man that he can bring momentous issues to the fore and make a decision about them. The weak are always forced to decide between alternatives they have not chosen themselves.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Alternatives  and particularly desirable alternatives  grow only on imaginary trees.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: The more one does and sees and feels  the more one is able to do  and the more genuine may be one's own appreciation of fundamental things like home  and love  and understanding companionship.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Our danger is not too few  but too many options ... to be puzzled by innumerable alternatives.
author: Sir Richard Livingstone

quote: The absence of alternatives clears the mind marvelously.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: I couldn't claim that I have never felt the urge to explore evil  but when you descend into hell you have to be very careful.
author: Kathleen Raine

quote: If decisions were a choice between alternatives  decisions would come easy. Decision is the selection and formulation of alternatives.
author: Kenneth Burke

quote: You cannot have your cake and eat it.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is better to arm and strengthen your hero  than to disarm and enfeeble your foe.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: You cannot sell the cow and sup the milk.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is only one answer to destruc-tiveness and that is creativity.
author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

quote: A door must either be shut or open.
author: Anonymous

quote: Here's a rule I recommend. Never practice two vices at once.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: You cannot serve God and Mammon.
author: Bible

quote: Between two stools one sits on the ground.
author: French proverb

quote: When you cannot make up your mind between two evenly balanced courses of action  choose the bolder.
author: W. J. Slim

quote: When confronted with two courses of action I jot down on a piece of paper all the arguments in favor of each one  then on the opposite side I write the arguments against each one. Then by weighing the arguments pro and con and cancelling them out  one against the other  I take the course indicated by what remains.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: You cannot have it both ways.
author: Anonymous

quote: I would sort out all the arguments and see which belonged to fear and which to creativeness. Other things being equal  I would make the decision which had the larger number of creative reasons on its side.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: Of two evils  choose the less.
author: Anonymous

quote: Of two evils  choose the prettier.
author: Carolyn Wells

quote: Where bad's the best  bad must be the choice.
author: Anonymous

quote: Both choices are painful  but only one is therapeutic.
author: Albert M. Wells

quote: God offers to every mind its choice between truth and repose. Take which you please-you can never have both.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Necessity relieves us from the embarrassment of choice.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: When you have to make a choice and don't make it  that is in itself a choice.
author: William James

quote: A man without decision can never be said to belong to himself  he is as a wave of the sea  or a feather in the air which every breeze blows about.
author: John Foster

quote: Nothing is so exhausting as indecision  and nothing is so futile.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Not to decide is to decide.
author: Harvey Cox

quote: Decision is a sharp knife that cuts clean and straight  indecision  a dull one that hacks and tears and leaves ragged edges behind it.
author: Gordon Graham

quote: There is no more miserable human being than one in whom nothing is habitual but indecision.
author: William James

quote: In not making the decision  you've made one. Not doing something is the same as doing it.
author: Ivan Bloch

quote: There is a time when we must firmly choose the course we will follow  or the relentless drift of events will make the decision for us.
author: Herbert B. Prochnow

quote: You can only predict things after they've happened.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: It is the mark of a good action that it appears inevitable  in retrospect.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: No one knows what he can to do until he tries.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Of all paths a man could strike into  there is  at any given moment  a best path which  here and now  it were of all things wisest for him to do. To find this path  and walk in it  is the one thing needful for him.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Decisions  particularly important ones  have always made me sleepy  perhaps because I know that I will have to make them by instinct  and thinking things out is only what other people tell me I should do.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: After a battle is over people talk a lot about how decisions were methodically reached  but actually there's always a hell of a lot of groping around.
author: Admiral Frank Jack Fletcher

quote: No question is ever settled until it is settled right.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: No man who has not sat in the assemblies of men can know the light  odd and uncertain ways in which decisions are often arrived at.
author: Sir Arthur Helps

quote: No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made. Destiny is made known silently.
author: Agnes de Mille

quote: A man must be able to cut a knot  for everything cannot be untied.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Once to every man and nation comes the moment to decide ... And the choice goes by forever t'wixt that darkness and that light.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Necessity is not an established fact  but an interpretation.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We are not permitted to choose the frame of our destiny. But what we put into it is ours.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: There is a point at which everything becomes simple and there is no longer any question of choice  because all you have staked will be lost if you look back. Life's point of no return.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Optimism is an intellectual choice.
author: Diana Schneider

quote: The lame man who keeps the right road outstrips the runner who takes a wrong one ... the more active and swift the latter is  the further he will go astray.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Nothing is more difficult  and therefore more precious  than to be able to decide.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: There is one quality more important than know-how.... This is know-how by which we determine not only how to accomplish our purposes  but what our purposes are to be.
author: Norbert Weiner

quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: What must be  shall be  and that which is a necessity to him that struggles is little more than choice to him that is willing.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: A wiser rule would be to make up your mind soberly what you want  peace or war  and then to get ready for what you want  for what we prepare for is what we shall get.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: We have resolved to endure the unendurable and suffer what is insufferable.
author: Emperor Hirohito

quote: Once a decision was made  I did not worry about it afterward.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The last  if not the greatest  of the human freedoms: to choose their own attitude in any given circumstance.
author: Bruno Bettelheim

quote: He who has a choice has trouble.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: We have left undone those things which we ought to have done  and we have done those things which we ought not to have done.
author: Anonymous

quote: Little deeds of kindness  little words of love  Make our earth an Eden like the heaven above.
author: Julia F. Carney

quote: Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
author: Pascal

quote: Heaven ne'er helps the man who will not help himself.
author: Sophocles

quote: Do not be afraid of defeat. You are never so near to victory as when defeated in a good cause.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: To lose Is to learn.
author: Anonymous

quote: We have fought this fight as long  and as well as we know how. We have been defeated. For us  as a Christian people  there is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: I let the American people down  and I have to carry that burden for the rest of my life. My political life is over. I will never again have an opportunity to serve in any official position. Maybe I can give a little advice from time to time.
author: Richard Nixon

quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education  nothing but the first step toward something better.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Who  apart From ourselves  can see any difference between Our victories and our defeats?
author: Christopher Fry

quote: They were never defeated  they were only killed.
author: French Foreign Legion

quote: The mountain remains unmoved at seeming defeat by the mist.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: It is defeat that turns bone to flint  it is defeat that turns gristle to muscle  it is defeat that makes men invincible.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education  nothing but the first step to something better.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Defeat should never be a source of discouragement but rather a fresh stimulus.
author: Robert South

quote: Demagogues and agitators are very unpleasant  but they are incidents to a free and constitutional country  and you must put up with these inconveniences or do without many important advantages.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: In every age the vilest specimens of human nature are to be found among demagogues.
author: Macaulay

quote: Every one that was in distress  and every one that was in debt  and every one that was discontented  gathered themselves unto him  and he became a captain over them.
author: I Samuel

quote: A wise fellow who is also worthless always charms the rabble.
author: Euripides

quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: In a democracy  the opposition is not only tolerated as constitutional  but must be maintained because it is indispensable.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: It has been said that Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Democracy is based on the conviction that man has the moral and intellectual capacity  as well as the inalienable right  to govern himself with reason and justice.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: If you want to understand democracy  spend less time in the library with Plato  and more time in the buses with people.
author: Simeon Strunsky

quote: Democracy is a small hard core of common agreement  surrounded by a rich variety of individual differences.
author: James Bryant Conant

quote: People often say that  in a democracy  decisions are made by a majority of the people. Of course  that is not true. Decisions are made by a majority of those who make themselves heard and who vote - a very different thing.
author: Walter H. Judd

quote: Democracy means government by the uneducated  while aristocracy means government by the badly educated.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: My definition of a free society is a society where it is safe to be unpopular.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: It is the greatest good to the greatest number which is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bent ham

quote: The greatest blessing of our democracy is freedom. But in the last analysis  our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time.
author: E. B. White

quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
author: Aristotle

quote: What men value in the world is not rights  but privileges.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: As I would not be a slave  so I would not be a master. This expresses my idea of democracy.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Democracy is a festival of mediocrity.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: The job of a citizen is to keep his mouth open.
author: Gunter Grass

quote: It would be folly to argue that the people cannot make political mistakes. They can and do make grave mistakes. They know it  they pay the penalty  but compared with the mistakes which have been made by every kind of autocracy they are unimportant.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Democracy is based upon the conviction that there are extraordinary possibilities in ordinary people.
author: Harry Emerson

quote: The world must be made safe for democracy.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Democracy is the government of the people  by the people  for the people.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Democracy means not "I am as good as you are " but "You are as good as I am."
author: Theodore Parker

quote: All the ills of democracy can be cured by more democracy.
author: Alfred E. Smith

quote: I believe in Democracy because it releases the energies of every human being.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: While democracy must have its organization and controls  its vital breath is individual liberty.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: People may live as much retired from the world as they please  but sooner or later  before they are aware  they will find themselves debtor or creditor to somebody.
author: Goethe

quote: He who imagines he can do without the world deceives himself much  but he who fancies the world cannot do without him is still more mistaken.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: It is easier to suppress the first desire than to satisfy all that follow it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: There are two tragedies in life. One is not to get your heart's desire. The other is to get it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Our desires always increase with our possessions. The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: He who desires naught will always be free.
author: E. R. Lefebvre Laboulaye

quote: Ah love! could you and I with Him conspire To grasp this sorry scheme of things entire  Would not we shatter it to bits - and then Re-mold it nearer to the heart's desire!
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Ail hope abandon  ye who enter here.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Despair is the conclusion of fools.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Despair doubles our strength.
author: English proverb

quote: It is the old practice of despots to use a part of the people to keep the rest in order.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Despotism can no more exist in a nation until the liberty of the press be destroyed than the night can happen before the sun is set.
author: Walter Colton

quote: I will believe in the right of one man to govern a nation despotically when I find a man born unto the world with boots and spurs  and a nation with saddles on their backs.
author: Algernon Sidney

quote: We are but as the instrument of Heaven. Our work is not design  but destiny.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: Every man meets his Waterloo at last.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: There is a divinity that shapes our ends  Rough-hew them how we will.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Here is the devil-and-all to pay.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Resist the Devil  and he will flee from you.
author: Bible

quote: The devil was sick  the devil a monk would be  The devil was well  the devil a monk was he.
author: Anonymous

quote: How art thou fallen from heaven  O Lucifer  son of the morning!
author: Bible

quote: Get thee behind me  Satan.
author: Bible

quote: He will give the devil his due.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The prince of darkness is a gentleman.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Everyone gets their rough day. No one gets a free ride. Today so far  I had a good day. I got a dial tone.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  Some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Some days you tame the tiger. And some days the tiger has you for lunch.
author: Tug McGraw

quote: Some days the dragon wins.
author: Anonymous

quote: The one law that does not change is that everything changes  and the hardship I was bearing today was only a breath away from the pleasures I would have tomorrow  and those pleasures would be all the richer because of the memories of this I was enduring.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Experience cold or heat  pleasure or pain. These experiences are fleeting  they come and go. Bear them patiently.
author: Sri Krishna

quote: To everything there is a season  A time for every purpose under heaven.... A time to weep  and a time to laugh  A time to mourn  and a time to dance.
author: Bible

quote: Let nothing disturb thee  Let nothing affright thee  All things are passing  God changeth never.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: This  too  shall pass.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The present will not long endure.
author: Pindar

quote: We do not live an equal life  but one of contrasts and patchwork  now a little joy  then a sorrow  now a sin  then a generous or brave action.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I feel successful when the writing goes well. This lasts five minutes. Once  when I was number one on the bestseller list  I also felt successful. That lasted three minutes.
author: Jacqueline Briskin

quote: Sadness and gladness succeed each other.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: I don't think that ... one gets a flash of happiness once  and never again  it is there within you  and it will come as certainly as death....
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Life comes in clusters  clusters of solitude  then clusters when there is hardly time to breathe.
author: May Sarton

quote: If winter comes  can spring be far behind?
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Human misery must somewhere have a stop  there is no wind that always blows a storm.
author: Euripides

quote: No winter lasts forever  no spring skips its turn.
author: Hal Borland

quote: There are trees that seem to die at the end of autumn. There are also the evergreens.
author: Gilbert Maxwell

quote: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection  not in books alone  but in every leaf in springtime.
author: Martin Luther

quote: For  lo  the winter is past  the rain is over and gone  the flowers appear on the earth.
author: Bible

quote: If matters go badly now  they will not always be so.
author: Horace

quote: Pain is never permanent.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: You will suffer and you will hurt. You will have joy and you will have peace.
author: Alison Cheek

quote: Pain is part of being alive  and we need to learn that. Pain does not last forever  nor is it necessarily unbearable  and we need to be taught that.
author: Rabbi Harold Kushner

quote: Pain is hard to bear.... But with patience  day by day  Even this shall pass away.
author: Theodore Tilton

quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become love. That is the mystery.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: I've been failing for  like  ten or eleven years. When it turns  it'll turn. Right now I'm just tryin' to squeeze through a very tight financial period  get the movie out  and put my things in order.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: I've never been poor  only broke. Being poor is a frame of mind. Being broke is a temporary situation.
author: Mike Todd

quote: In the darkest hour the soul is replenished and given strength to continue and endure.
author: Heart Warrior Chosa

quote: He that can't endure the bad will not live to see the good.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Our toil is sweet with thankfulness  Our burden is our boon  The curse of earth's gray morning is The blessing of its noon.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Were it possible for us to see further than our knowledge reaches  perhaps we would endure our sadnesses with greater confidence than our joys. For they are moments when something new has entered into us  something unknown.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: We may draw good outof evil  we must not do evil  that good may come.
author: Maria Weston Chapman

quote: You will find a joy in overcoming obstacles.
author: Helen Keller

quote: What we call the beginning is often an end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: When one door of happiness closes  another opens  but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Death is a door life opens.
author: Adela Rogers St. John

quote: The world is round  and the place which may seem like the end may also be only the beginning.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: Perhaps someday it will be pleasant to remember even this.
author: Virgil

quote: One day in retrospect the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The crisis of today is the joke of tomorrow.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Sometimes I found that in my happy moments I could not believe that I had ever been miserable.
author: Joanna Field

quote: If our education had included training to bear unpleasantness and to let the first shock pass until we could think more calmly  many an unbearable situation would become manageable  and many a nervous illness avoided. There is a proverb expressing this. It says  trouble is a tunnel through which we pass and not a brick wall against which we must break our head.
author: Claire Weeks

quote: Time  in the turning-over of days  works change  for better or worse.
author: Pindar

quote: Experience is what really happens to you in the long run  the truth that finally overtakes you.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

quote: Time is like a river of fleeting events  and its current is strong  as soon as something comes into sight  it is swept past us  and something else takes its place  and that too will be swept away.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Time cools  time clarifies  no mood can be maintained quite unaltered through the course of hours.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Time bears away all things.
author: Virgil

quote: Come what come may  time and the hour runs through the roughest day.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Time brings all things to pass.
author: Aeschylus

quote: We undo ourselves by impatience. Misfortunes have their life and their limits  their sickness and their health.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour  whatever he does  whoever he is.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: That's the advantage of having lived sixty-five years. You don't feel the need to be impatient any longer.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Who longest waits most surely wins.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Patience is a bitter plant  but it has sweet fruit.
author: German proverb

quote: No emergency excuses you from exercising tolerance.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: I believe the sign of maturity is accepting deferred gratification.
author: Peggy Cahn

quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Being human  we should bear all we can.
author: Norma Meacock

quote: Adopt the pace of nature  her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: You can't have genius without patience.
author: Margaret Deland

quote: The most potent and sacred command which can be laid upon any artist is the command: wait.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: How poor are they that have not patience? What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: All things come round to him who will but wait.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Panic is not an effective long-term organizing strategy.
author: Starhawk

quote: Self-denial is painful for a moment  but very agreeable in the end.
author: Jane Taylor

quote: And he shall reign a goodly king And sway his hand o'er every clime With peace writ on his signet ring  Who bides his time.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: It takes time to succeed because success is merely the natural reward of taking time to do anything well.
author: Joseph Ross

quote: Patience and fortitude conquer all things.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Be not afraid of growing slowly  be afraid only of standing still.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Wisely and slow. They stumble that run fast.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No great thing is created suddenly  any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig  I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom  then bear fruit  then ripen.
author: Epictetus

quote: Time deals gently only with those who take it gently.
author: Anatole France

quote: Hold on  hold fast  hold out. Patience is genius.
author: Georges de Buffon

quote: Genius is nothing but a greater aptitude for patience.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words: wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Genius is eternal patience.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Serene I fold my hands and wait.
author: John Burroughs

quote: The race is not to the swift  nor the battle to the strong.
author: Bible

quote: Everything comes if a man will only wait.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The secret of patience ... to do something else in the meantime.
author: Anonymous

quote: Have patience with all things  but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections  but instantly set about remedying them-every day begin the task anew.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Let us then be up and doing  With a heart for any fate  Still achieving  still pursuing  Learn to labor and to wait.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: God will wait as long as it takes for us.
author: Reverend R. Walters

quote: Waiting is not mere empty hoping. It has the inner certainty of reaching the goal.
author: I Ching

quote: All things come to him who waits- provided he knows what he is waiting for.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Hope and patience are two sovereign remedies for all  the surest reposals  the softest cushions to lean on in adversity.
author: Robert Burton

quote: The strongest of all warriors are these two-Time and Patience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Who bides his time tastes the sweet Of honey in the saltiest tear  And though he fares with slowest feet Joy runs to meet him drawing near.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

quote: God grant us patience!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.
author: Bible

quote: There is nothing so bitter that a patient mind cannot find some solace for it.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Patience is the best remedy for every trouble.
author: Plautus

quote: For ye have need of patience....
author: Bible

quote: They are ill discoverers that think there is no land  when they see nothing but sea.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The best way out of a difficulty is through it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A diplomat is a man who remembers a lady's birthday but forgets her age.
author: Anonymous

quote: When a diplomat says yes he means perhaps  when he says perhaps he means no  when he says no he is no diplomat.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I speak the truth  and they never believe me.
author: Anonymous

quote: Diplomacy is to do and say The nastiest thing in the nicest way.
author: Isaac Goldberg

quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
author: Sir Boyle Roche

quote: The best-laid schemes o' mice an' men  Gang aft a-gley  And leave us nought but grief and pain  For promised joy.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Disappointments are to the soul what a thunder-storm is to the air.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Men would be angels  Angels would be gods.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Now is the Winter of our discontent.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I was born to other things.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Discretion in speech is more than eloquence.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: A sound discretion is not so much indicated by never making a mistake as by never repeating it.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Great ability without discretion comes almost invariably to a tragic end.
author: Leon Gambetta

quote: Let your own discretion be your tutor  suit the action to the word  the word to the action.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The better part of valour is discretion.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Disease is the retribution of outraged Nature.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Disease is an experience of so-called mortal mind. It is fear made manifest on the body.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Desperate diseases require desperate remedies.
author: English proverb

quote: Some remedies are worse than the disease.
author: Syrus

quote: Whatever disgrace we may have deserved  it is almost always in our power to re-establish our character.
author: Plautus

quote: No one can disgrace us but ourselves.
author: J. G. Holland

quote: Doubt the man who swears to his devotion.
author: Mme. Louise Colet

quote: Women distrust men too much in general  and too little in particular.
author: Philibert Commerson

quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
author: George Eliot

quote: Doctrine is nothing but the skin of truth set up and stuffed.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: How absurd to try to make two men think alike on matters of religion  when I cannot make two timepieces agree!
author: Charles V

quote: In religion as in politics it so happens that we have less charity for those who believe half our creed  than for diose who deny the whole of it.
author: Walter Colton

quote: You can and you can't  You will and you won't  You'll be damn'd if you do  You'll be damn'd if you don't.
author: Lorenzo Dow

quote: "Orthodoxy  my Lord " said Bishop Warburton  in a whisper   -  "orthodoxy is my doxy   -  heterodoxy is another man's doxy."
author: Joseph Priestley

quote: Do not disturb the sleeping dog.
author: Alessandro Allegri

quote: Every dog is entitled to one bite.
author: Anonymous

quote: Who loves me will love my dog also.
author: St. Bernard of Clairvaux

quote: You're only a dog  old fellow  a dog  and you've had your day  But never a friend of all my friends has been truer than you alway.
author: Julian S. Cutler

quote: I agree with Agassiz that dogs possess something very like a conscience.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Oh  the saddest of sights in a world of sin Is a little lost pup with his tail tucked in!
author: Arthur Guiterman

quote: Fox-terriers are born with about four times as much original sin in them as other dogs.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: The more one comes to know men  the more one comes to admire the dog.
author: Joussenel

quote: The dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.
author: Matthew

quote: The cowardly dog barks more violently than it bites.
author: Quintus Curtius Rufus

quote: Every dog must have his day.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Gentlemen of die Jury: The one  absolute  unselfish friend that man can have in this selfish world  the one that never deserts him  the one that never proves ungrateful or treacherous  is his dog.
author: Senator George Graham Vest

quote: Galileo called doubt the father of invention  it is certainly the pioneer.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Of that there is no manner of doubt -  No probable  possible shadow of doubt -  No possible doubt whatever.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: We know accurately only when we know little  with knowledge doubt increases.
author: Goethe

quote: When in doubt  win the trick.
author: Edmund Hoyle

quote: I respect faith  but doubt is what gets you an education.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat.
author: Romans

quote: To be  or not to be  that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune  Or to take arms against a sea of troubles  And by opposing end them?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Our doubts are traitors And make us lose the good we oft might win By fearing to attempt.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt  Believe me  than in half the creeds
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: I'm from Missouri  you must show me.
author: Colonel Willard D. Vandiver

quote: Unrest and uncertainty are our lot.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Life is uncertain. Eat dessert first.
author: Ernestine Ulmer

quote: If we insist on being as sure as is conceivable ... we must be content to creep along the ground  and can never soar.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Nothing  perhaps  is strange  once you have accepted life itself  the great strange business which includes all lesser strangeness.
author: Rose Macaulay

quote: The shortest period of time lies between the minute you put some money away for a rainy day and the unexpected arrival of rain.
author: Jane Bryant Quinn

quote: Our lives are never certain  even for an hour.
author: Ferrant Sanchez Calavera

quote: Throughout this life  you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
author: Huang Po

quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned  the hard way  that some poems don't rhyme  and some stories don't have a clear beginning  middle  and end. Life is about not knowing  having to change  taking the moment and making the best of it without knowing what's going to happen next.
author: Gilda Radner

quote: Where will I be five years from now? I delight in not knowing.
author: Mario Thomas

quote: The longing for certainty ... is in every human mind. But certainty is generally illusion.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: No great deed is done by falterers who ask for certainty.
author: George Eliot

quote: Every year  if not every day  we have to wager our salvation upon some prophecy based upon imperfect knowledge.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: We are not certain  we are never certain.
author: Albert Camus

quote: We live in an epoch in which the solid ground of our preconceived ideas shakes daily under our certain feet.
author: Barbara Ward

quote: All business proceeds on beliefs  or judgment of probabilities  and not on certainties.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: The man who insists upon seeing with perfect clearness before he decides  never decides.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: There is nothing certain in a man's life but that he must lose it.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: Ah  what a dusty answer gets the soul when hot for certainties in this  our life!
author: George Meredith

quote: When I was young I was sure of everything  in a few years  having been mistaken a thousand times  I was not half so sure of most things as I was before  at present  I am hardly sure of anything but what God has revealed.
author: John Wesley

quote: We can be absolutely certain only about things we do not understand.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: You are all you will ever have for certain.
author: June Havoc

quote: Certitude is not the test of certainty. We have been cock-sure of many things that were not so.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: A reasonable probability is the only certainty.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Doubt is not a pleasant state  but certainty is a ridiculous one.
author: Voltaire

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: To be absolutely certain about something  one must know everything  or nothing  about it.
author: Olin Miller

quote: Free man is by necessity insecure  thinking man by necessity uncertain.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: We sail within a vast sphere  ever drifting in uncertainty  driven from end to end.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Something must be left to chance  nothing is sure in a sea fight.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: There is nothing certain about war except that one side won't win.
author: Sir Ian Hamilton

quote: There is only one thing about which I am certain  and this is that there is very little about which one can be certain.
author: W Somerset Maugham

quote: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: I'm often wrong  but never in doubt.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: There is one thing certain  namely  that we can have nothing certain  therefore it is not certain that we can have nothing certain.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Every area of trouble gives out a ray of hope  and the one unchangeable certainty is that nothing is certain or unchangeable.
author: John E. Kennedy

quote: Any coward can fight a battle when he's sure of winning.
author: George Eliot

quote: The demand is for certainty is a sign of weakness.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: The unknown is what it is. And to be frightened of it is what sends everybody scurrying around chasing dreams  illusions  wars  peace  love  hate  all that.... Accept that it's unknown  and it's plain sailing.
author: John Lennon

quote: Only a weak mind seeks ultimate answers.
author: Agnes Thornton

quote: When nothing is sure  everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: He who forecasts all perils will never sail the sea.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is a time for departure  even when there's no certain place to go.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of shore for a very long time.
author: Andre Gide

quote: To teach how to live with uncertainty  yet without being paralyzed by hesitation  is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy can do.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: The successful man is he who  when he sees that no further certainty is attainable  promptly decides on the most probable side  as if he were completely sure it was right.
author: Mark Rutherford

quote: Not seeing is half-believing.
author: Vita Sackville-West

quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched-they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There is no advancement to him who stands trembling because he cannot see the end from the beginning.
author: E. J. Klemme

quote: I am a woman who understands the necessity of an impulse whose goal or origin still lie beyond me.
author: Olga Broumas

quote: To end with certainty  we must begin with doubting.
author: Stanislaus

quote: Gardening is an exercise in optimism.
author: Maria Schinz

quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: No object is mysterious. The mystery is your eye.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Faith hasn't got no eyes  but she's long-legged.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Maturity of mind is the capacity to endure uncertainty.
author: John H. Finley

quote: Don't be afraid of the space between your dreams and reality. If you can dream it  you can make it so.
author: Belva Davis

quote: If a man will begin with certainties  he shall end in doubts  but if he will content to begin with doubts  he shall end in certainties.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I said here's the river I want to flow on  here's the direction I want to go  and put my boat in. I was ready for the river to take unexpected turns and present obstacles.
author: Nancy Woodhull

quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nobody can really guarantee the future. The best we can do is size up the chances  calculate the risks involved  estimate our ability to deal with them and make our plans with confidence.
author: Henry Ford II

quote: Every time I think that I'm getting old  and gradually going to the grave  something else happens.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: Many live in dread of what is coming. Why should we? The unknown puts adventure into life. ... The unexpected around the corner gives a sense of anticipation and surprise. Thank God for the unknown future.
author: E. Stanley Jones

quote: I think I look good out there. I'm strong  powerful  and artistic. But I have my doubts as much as anyone.
author: Jill Trenary

quote: If I ever felt inclined to be timid as I was going into a room full of people  I would say to myself  "You're the cleverest member of one of the cleverest families in the cleverest class of the cleverest nation. ... Why should you be frightened?"
author: Beatrice Potter Webb

quote: Action will remove the doubts that theory cannot solve.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: To Death I yield  but not to Doubt  who slays before!
author: Edith M. Thomas

quote: Soon after a heart-wrung decision  something inevitably occurs to cast doubt on your choice. Holding steady against that doubt usually proves your decision.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: Doubt breeds doubt.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: It's the moment you think you can't that you realize you can.
author: Celine Dion

quote: From a shy  timid girl I had become a woman of resolute character  who could no longer be frightened by the struggle with troubles.
author: Anna Dostoevsky

quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Doubts and mistrust are the mere panic of timid imagination  which the steadfast heart will conquer  and the large mind transcend.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Doubt indulged soon becomes doubt realized.
author: Frances Ridley Havergal

quote: When one devotes oneself to meditation  mental burdens  unnecessary worries  and wandering thoughts drop off one by one  life seems to run smoothly and pleasantly. A student may now depend on intuition to make decisions. As one acts on intuition  second thought  with its dualism  doubt and hesitation  does not arise.
author: Nyogen Senzaki

quote: In doubt  fear is the worst of prophets.
author: Statius

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: In case of doubt  decide in favor of what is correct.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: Faith and doubt both are needed  not as antagonists  but working side by side to take us around the unknown curve.
author: Lillian Smith

quote: Our doubts are traitors  and make us lose the good we often might win  by fearing to attempt.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
author: William Wrigley

quote: When in doubt  do it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Yes  I have doubted. I have wandered off the path  but I always return. It is intuitive  an intrinsic  built-in sense of direction. I seem always to find my way home.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Self distrust is the cause of most of our failures. In the assurance of strength  there is strength  and they are the weakest  however strong  who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Doubt yourself and you doubt everything you see. Judge yourself and you see judges everywhere. But if you listen to the sound of your own voice  you can rise above doubt and judgment. And you can see forever.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. There is no philosophy which will help a man to succeed when he is always doubting his ability to do so  and thus attracting failure. No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.
author: Charles Baudouin

quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing.
author: William Congreve

quote: I used to tremble from nerves so badly that the only way I could hold my head steady was to lower my chin practically to my chest and look up at Bogie. That was the beginning of "The Look."
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: When nothing is sure  everything is possible.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: Uncertainty and mystery are energies of life. Don't let them scare you unduly  for they keep boredom at bay and spark creativity.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: The quest for certainty blocks the search for meaning. Uncertainty is the very condition to impel man to unfold his powers.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: All uncertainly is fruitful... so long as it is accompanied by the wish to understand.
author: Antonio Machado

quote: I'm delighted that the future is unsure. That's the way it should be.
author: William Sloane Coffin

quote: When we are not sure  we are alive.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better  whereas enslavement is a certainty of the worst.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The only thing that makes life possible is permanent  intolerable uncertainty  not knowing what comes next.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: In the face of uncertainty  there is nothing wrong with hope.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: If there were dreams to sell  Merry and sad to tell  And the crier rung his bell  What would you buy?
author: T. L. Beddoes

quote: I dreamt that I dwelt in marble halls  With vassals and serfs at my side.
author: Alfred Bunn

quote: Abou Ben Adhem (may his tribe increase!) Awoke one night from a deep dream of peace.
author: Leigh Hunt

quote: For dhrames always go by conthraries  my dear.
author: Samuel Lover

quote: We are such stuff As dreams are made on  and our little life Is rounded with a sleep.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Till the day when I'll be going down that Long  long trail with you.
author: Stoddard King

quote: When you're all dressed up and no place to go.
author: Benjamin Hapgood Burt

quote: If a woman were about to proceed to her execution  she would demand a little time to perfect her toilet.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: Eat to please thyself  but dress to please others.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A torch-light procession marching down your throat.
author: John L. O'Sullivan

quote: First you take a drink  then the drink takes a drink  then the drink takes you.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: For when the wine is in  the wit is out.
author: Thomas Becon

quote: He neither drank  smoked  nor rode a bicycle. Living frugally  saving his money  he died early  surrounded by greedy relatives. It was a great lesson to me.
author: John Barrymore

quote: He who drinks a little too much drinks much too much.
author: Old saying

quote: I am only a beer teetotaller  not a champagne teetotaller.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The worst thing about some men is that when they are not drunk they are sober.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I have never been drunk  but I've often been overserved.
author: George Gobel

quote: In vino Veritas. (In wine there is truth.)
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: The morning cup of coffee has an exhilaration about it which the cheering influence of the afternoon or evening cup of tea cannot be expected to reproduce.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: They talk of my drinking but never my thirst.
author: Old saying

quote: What  when drunk  one sees in other women  one sees in Garbo sober.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: You are not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
author: Dean Martin

quote: I like liquor - its taste and its effects - and that is just the reason why I never drink it.
author: Thomas Stonewall Jackson

quote: The Persians are very fond of wine ... It is also their general practice to deliberate upon affairs of weight when they are drunk  and then in the morning  when they are sober  the decision to which they came the night before is put before them by the master of the house in which it was made  and if it is then approved they act on it  if not  they set it aside. Sometimes  however  they are sober at their first deliberations  but in this case they always reconsider the matter under the influence of wine.
author: Herodotus

quote: Drunkenness is temporary suicide: the happiness that it brings is merely negative  a momentary cessation of unhappiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Bacchus has drowned more men than Neptune.
author: Guiseppe Garibaldi

quote: Temperance is the control of all the functions of our bodies. The man who refuses liquor  goes in for apple pie and develops a paunch  is no ethical leader for me.
author: John Erskine

quote: Nothing ever tasted any better than a cold beer on a beautiful afternoon with nothing to look forward to but more of the same.
author: Hugh Hood

quote: Moderation is commonly firm  and firmness is commonly successful.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Abstinence is as easy for me as temperance would be difficult.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I drink to make other people interesting.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: One of the disadvantages of wine is that is makes a man mistake words for thoughts.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The innkeeper loves the drunkard  but not for a son-in-law.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Whisky drowns some troubles and floats a lot more.
author: Robert C. Edwards

quote: Malt does more than Milton can To justify God's ways to man.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: A man hath no better thing under the sun  than to eat  and to drink  and to be merry.
author: Bible

quote: Drink not the third glass - which thou can'st not tame when once it is within thee.
author: George Herbert

quote: An Irish queer: a fellow who prefers women to drink.
author: Sean O'Faolain

quote: Jellinek's disease (alcoholism) is responsible for: 50 percent of all auto fatalities 80 percent of all home violence 30 percent of all suicides 60 percent of all child abuse 65 percent of all drownings It is estimated that when a woman contracts the disease  her husband leaves her in nine out often cases  when a man contracts it  his wife leaves in one out of ten cases.
author: Kathleen Whalen Fitzgerald

quote: Eat bread at pleasure  drink wine by measure.
author: Randle Cotgrave

quote: We frequently hear of people dying from too much drinking. That this happens is a matter of record. But the blame almost always is placed on whisky. Why this should be I never could understand. You can die from drinking too much of anything - coffee  water  milk  soft drinks and all such stuff as that. And so long as the presence of death lurks with anyone who goes through the simple act of swallowing  I will make mine whisky.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: It's a naive domestic burgundy without any breeding  but I think you'll be amused by its presumption.
author: James Thurber

quote: Drunkenness is nothing but voluntary madness.
author: Seneca

quote: There are more old drunkards than old physicians.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: He is . . . like many other geniuses  a greater friend to the bottle  than the bottle is to him.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie

quote: Boys should abstain from all use of wine until their eighteenth year  for it is wrong to add fire to fire.
author: Plato

quote: I always keep a supply of stimulant handy in case I see a snake - which I also keep handy.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: We had gone out there to pass the beautiful day of high summer like true Irishmen - locked in the dark Snug of a public house.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The whole world is about three drinks behind.
author: Humphrey Bogart

quote: Drunkenness is temporary suicide: the happiness that it brings is merely negative  a momentary cessation of unhappiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: There was an old hen And she had a wooden leg  And every damned morning She laid another egg  She was the best damned chicken On the whole damned farm -  And another little drink Wouldn't do us any harm.
author: American Folksong

quote: It's a long time between drinks.
author: Anonymous
